stupesco: <entryFree id="n45667" type="main" key="stu^pesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [stupeo], <hi rend="ital">to grow astonished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become amazed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 32, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupeus: <entryFree id="n45668" type="main" key="stu_pe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stūpĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. stuppeus.</entryFree>
stupiditas: <entryFree id="n45669" type="main" key="stu^pi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stupidus</etym>, <sense id="n45669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">senselessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dullness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi> (very rare), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 287 Rib.): incredibilis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupido: <entryFree id="n45670" type="main" key="stu^pi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to confound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amaze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astonish</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pavidum vulgus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 572</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, § 725</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupidus: <entryFree id="n45671" type="main" key="stu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stupeo</etym>, <sense id="n45671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">struck</hi> <pb n="1770" /> <cb n="STUP" /> <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45671.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stupida sine animo asto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid stas stupida? quid taces?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupidi timore obmutuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 52, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Echionis tabula te stupidum detinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populus studio stupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45671.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45671.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zopyrus physiognomon stupidum esse Socratem dixit et bardum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:197" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 197</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 239</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: homo, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 400, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45671.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things: colles, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not susceptible of tillage</hi>, Ven. Carm. 3, 12, 39.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
stupor: <entryFree id="n45672" type="main" key="stu^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stupeo</etym>, <sense id="n45672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">numbness; dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefaction; astonishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wonder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazement</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. torpor): stupor in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensūs stupor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor obstitit lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: stupor omnium animos tenet. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos stupor urget inertes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor debilitasque linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus te stupor oppressit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stupor silentiumque ceteros patrum defixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor omnes et admiratio incessit, unde tam subitum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7" default="NO">12, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 344</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45672.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolidity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mandata! quā adrogantiā! Quo stupore!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuporem hominis, vel dicam pecudis, attendite ... Sit in verbis tuis hic stupor: quanto in rebus sententiisque major,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis stupor hic, Menelae, fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 361</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for stupidus, <hi rend="ital">a fool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simpleton</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis iste meus stupor nil videt, nihil audit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum demum ingemuit corvi deceptus stupor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 13, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuporatus: <entryFree id="n45673" type="hapax" key="stu^po_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stupor</etym>, <sense id="n45673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">regarded with amazement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wonder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuppa: <entryFree id="n45674" type="greek" key="stuppa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stuppa</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">stūpa, stī-pa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stu/pph</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">stu/ph</foreign>), <sense id="n45674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the coarse part of flax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oakum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:880" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 880</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 682</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:135" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 135</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=317" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 317</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
stupparius: <entryFree id="n45675" type="hapax" key="stuppa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stuppārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stūpār-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stuppa</etym>, <sense id="n45675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tow-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuppeus: <entryFree id="n45676" type="main" key="stuppe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stuppĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stūpĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consisting of tow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera fundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>burning tow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>flax</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuprator: <entryFree id="n45677" type="main" key="stu_^pra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^prātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stupro</etym>, <sense id="n45677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defiler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debaucher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravisher</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:42" default="NO">7, 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 896" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 896</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupre: <entryFree id="n45678" type="hapax" key="stu_^pre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^prē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>stuprum</etym>, <sense id="n45678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shamefully</hi>: foede stupreque castigor cottidie, Neleus ap. Fest. s. v. stuprum, p. 317 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
stupro: <entryFree id="n45679" type="main" key="stu_^pro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^pro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to defile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45679.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprandis moribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45679.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi> by unchastity, <hi rend="ital">to debauch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deflour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuprate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui illam stupravit noctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne stupraretur (filia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucretia vi stuprata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simillimi feminis mares stuprati et constupratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 15, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuum stupravit et stupratus se suspendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuprosus: <entryFree id="n45680" type="hapax" key="stu_^pro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^prōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debauched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>, n. 8.</sense></entryFree>
stuprum: <entryFree id="n45681" type="main" key="stu_^prum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^prum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defilement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45681.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (so only ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum pro turpitudine antiquos dixisse apparet in Appii sententiis: qui animi compotem esse, ne quid fraudis stuprique ferocia pariat. Naevius: seseque ii perire mavolunt ibidem, quam cum stupro redire ad suos populares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=317" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 317</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n45681.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi> by unchastity of any sort, <hi rend="ital">debauchery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lewdness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violation</hi>, always implying the infliction of dishonor on the subject, whether male or female, not used of dealings with prostitutes,<cb n="STYP" />  etc. (opp. pudicitia; cf.: adulterium, incestum; class.): conjugem inlexe in stuprum, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 68</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 205 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi quis pudenda queritur, ut stuprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probri, stupri, dedecoris argutam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupra et corruptelae et adulteria, incesta denique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:35:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 35, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nefarium stuprum non per illum (factum)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupri plenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stuprum Bonae Deae pulvinaribus intulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:39:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 39, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum reginae intulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quamcumque in domum stuprum intulerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eum) cum germanā sorore nefarium stuprum fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei cum Fulviā stupri vetus consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui primo ingentis sumptus stupro corporis toleraverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 3</bibl></cit>: rapere ad stuprum virgines matronasque, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 456, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiae stupro violatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis polluitur casta domus stupris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupri mercede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor stupri tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronas ad populum stupri damnatas pecuniā multavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 31, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 32, 21; 39, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum saevi pati tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 302" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonii ipsi omnia concedunt in amore juvenum, praeter stuprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., for the person committing it: <cit><quote lang="la">una Clytemnestrae stuprum vehit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the paramour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 57.</sense></entryFree>
stura: <entryFree id="n45682" type="main" key="Stura"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stura</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Cisalpine Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that flows into the Po near Turin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sturii: <entryFree id="n45683" type="main" key="Sturii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sturii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who held an island in the Rhine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 15, 29, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sturium: <entryFree id="n45684" type="main" key="Sturium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sturium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Mediterranean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the coast of Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sturnini: <entryFree id="n45685" type="main" key="Sturni_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sturnīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Calabria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sturninus: <entryFree id="n45686" type="main" key="sturni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sturnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sturnus</etym>, <sense id="n45686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speckled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like a starling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 66, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sturnus: <entryFree id="n45687" type="main" key="sturnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sturnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ya/r</foreign>; mod. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">yaro/ni</foreign>; Germ. star; Engl. star-ling</etym>, <sense id="n45687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a starling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stare</hi>: Sturnus vulgaris, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 24, 35, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:160" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 17, 45, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:120" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 42, 59, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:55:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 55, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stygialis: <entryFree id="n45688" type="main" key="Sty^gi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stygĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Styx, II. 2.</entryFree>
stygius: <entryFree id="n45689" type="main" key="Sty^gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stygĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Styx, II. 1.</entryFree>
stylobates: <entryFree id="n45690" type="greek" key="sty^lo^ba^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stylŏbătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">stylŏbăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stuloba/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n45690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pedestal of a column</hi> or <hi rend="ital">row of columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stylobate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:13:3" default="NO">1, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stylus: <entryFree id="n45691" type="main" key="sty^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. stilus.</entryFree>
stymma: <entryFree id="n45692" type="greek" key="stymma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stymma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stu/mma</foreign>, <sense id="n45692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief ingredient</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foundation of an unguent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stymphalus: <entryFree id="n45693" type="main" key="Stympha_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stymphālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stymphā-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stu/mfalos</foreign>, <sense id="n45693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mountain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and lake of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated in fable as the haunt of a species of odious birds of prey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very vexatious to the inhabitants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but which were finally destroyed by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:100" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:298" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 298</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 2, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stymphala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45693.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stymphālĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Stymphalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stymphalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45693.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stym-phālĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Stymphalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45693.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stymphālis</orth> (scanned Stymphălis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 19, 5</bibl>), ĭdis, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Stymphalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stymphalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:273" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 273</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 20" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:30" default="NO">30</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 300</bibl>. —Called, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stymphalides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:102:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 102, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2</bibl>, prooem. 37.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 422" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 422</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 849 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agam. 849 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
styphelus: <entryFree id="n45694" type="main" key="Sty^phe^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Styphĕlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 459</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stypsis: <entryFree id="n45695" type="main" key="stypsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stypsis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stipsis</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stu/yis</foreign>, <sense id="n45695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the contracting power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tendency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <trans><tr>astringency</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 4</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1, 1</bibl>, as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
stypteria: <entryFree id="n45696" type="greek" key="stypte_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">styptērĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stupthri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n45696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:9:3:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 9, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> <cb n="SUAD" /></sense></entryFree>
stypticus: <entryFree id="n45697" type="greek" key="stypti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">styptĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">stuptiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">astringent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">styptic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 73, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 36, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>of an acid taste</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oct. 14, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
styrax: <entryFree id="n45698" type="greek" key="sty^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">styrax</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏrax</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 8, 5</bibl>), <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stu/rac</foreign>, <sense id="n45698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tree; and also the resinous gum of that tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 55, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 15, § 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 167</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">styrăcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made from storax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
styx: <entryFree id="n45699" type="main" key="Styx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Styx</orth>, <itype>ygis and ygos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stu/c</foreign>. <sense id="n45699.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fountain in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the icy-cold water of which caused death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:14:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45699.1" n="II" level="1"> In mythology, <hi rend="ital">a river in the infernal regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which the gods swore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 480</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 322</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 635</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:570" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 570</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 269 al.</bibl>— Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the infernal regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the lower world</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 8, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:60:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 60, 4</bibl>; and for <hi rend="ital">poison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscuit undis Styga Sidoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 163" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 163</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45699.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stygĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Styx</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stygian;</hi> and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the lower world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infernal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Charon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 506</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 638</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 252</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Proserpine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:526" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:730" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 139</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pernicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awful</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:855" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 855</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:791" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 791</bibl></cit> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n45699.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stygĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Stygian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 373</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suadted: <entryFree id="n45700" type="gloss" key="suad ted"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suad ted</orth> <itype>idem ait esse sic te</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=351" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 351</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
suada: <entryFree id="n45701" type="main" key="Sua_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suāda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. suadus.</entryFree>
suadela: <entryFree id="n45702" type="main" key="sua_de_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suādēla</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">suādella</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suadeo</etym>. <sense id="n45702.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasion</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jam perducebam illam ad me suadela mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadela depravata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 28, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his et hujusmodi suadelis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 225, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45702.1" n="II" level="1"> Suadela, personified, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of Persuasion</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*peiqw/</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suadenter: <entryFree id="n45703" type="main" key="sua_denter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suādenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. suadeo <sense id="n45703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
suadeo: <entryFree id="n45704" type="main" key="sua_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suādĕo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 2</itype> (scanned as a trisyl., sŭādent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1157</bibl>: suavis, Key, § 972), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. svad-, to taste, please; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(d-, a(nda/nw</foreign>, to please; Lat. suavis, suadela, etc.; Germ. süsz; Engl. sweet], <hi rend="ital">to advise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recommend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuade</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: hortor, moneo). </sense><sense id="n45704.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>, and with <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>, an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45704.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non jubeo, sed, si me consulis, suadeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instare, Suadere, orare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte suadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itane suades?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita faciam, ut suades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male suadendo lacerant homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene suadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45704.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an C. Trebonio persuasi? cui ne suadere quidem ausus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui sapientius suadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45704.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo quod suasit, dissuadet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digito silentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe diversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietem et concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tibi suadeam, suadeam meo patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa multis saepe suasit perperam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quod ipse tibi suaseris, idem mihi persuasum putato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mi igitur suades?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus placet, magis quod suadetur: quod dissuadetur placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45704.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vide ne facinus facias, cum mori suadeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo suaserit studiosis dicendi adulescentibus in gestu discendo elaborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juturnam misero fateor succurrere fratri Suasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:814" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 814</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hoc quidem suaserim, uni se alicui proprie addicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: praesidibus onerandas<pb n="1771" /> <cb n="SUAR" />  tributo provincias suadentibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi mihi ab adulescentiā suasissem, nihil esse in vitā magnopere expetendum nisi laudem,</quote> <trans><tr>persuaded</tr>, <tr>convinced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadebant amici nullam esse rationem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl>.—Cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potest aliquid suaderi perdere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, n. 26: <cit><quote lang="la">Megadorus a sorore suasus ducere uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:Arg. 1, v. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. Arg. 1, v. 6</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea, ut decumbamus, suadebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadebimus, ut laudem humanitatis potius concupiscat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orat, ut suadeam Philolacheti, Ut istas remittat sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea me, ut sibi essem legatus non solum suasit, verum etiam rogavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll. <foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suadet, ne praecipitetur editio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Ep. ad Tryph. 1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Ep. ad Tryph. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum acerrime suasisset Lepido, ne se cum Antonio jungeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadere Prisco, ne supra principem scanderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde istud facias ipse, quod faciamus, nobis suades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadeo cenemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suadere, Pharnabazo id negotii daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ego neque te jubeo, neque veto neque suadeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem ejus tacite suasi ac denique persuasi, secederet paululum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. also supra. <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>, the pass. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 42</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucorum asseverationibus suasi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">suasuri de pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45704.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">to urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">induce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">autumno suadente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 340</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 724</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadente pavore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:668" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 668</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:12" default="NO">12, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita suadentibus annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba suadentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:435" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum religio potuit suadere malorum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadent cadentia sidera somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: cui nulla malum sententia suadet, Ut faceret facinus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 248 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">me pietas matris potius commodum suadet sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua me virtus quemvis sufferre laborem Suadet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:175" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe levi somnum suadebit inire susurro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 56</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45704.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in publicists' lang.: suadere legem, rogationem, etc., <hi rend="ital">to recommend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak in favor of</hi> a proposed law or bill: <cit><quote lang="la">legem Voconiam magnā voce et bonis lateribus suasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 21</bibl> (opp. dissuadere): <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac rogatione suadendā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadere de pace, bello, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suadendo et dissuadendo tria primum spectanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suāsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a persuasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasive saying</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">serpentis suasa loquentis accepi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Gen. 103</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 1</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">suādenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">persuasively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui in litibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suadibilis: <entryFree id="n45705" type="main" key="sua_di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suādĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suadeo</etym>, <sense id="n45705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be persuaded</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 3, 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45705.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Persuasive</hi>: doctrina, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 51.</sense></entryFree>
suadus: <entryFree id="n45706" type="main" key="sua_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suādus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">persuading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasive</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">delenifica et suada facundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:453" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, 272, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suāda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, personified, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of Persuasion</hi>, the Greek <foreign lang="greek">*peiqw/</foreign>: Suadae medulla (Cethegus), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 309 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
sualiternicum: <entryFree id="n45707" type="main" key="sualiterni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sualiternĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of reddish amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suamet: <entryFree id="n45708" type="main" key="sua^met"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suămet</orth>, v. suus and met.</entryFree>
suanenses: <entryFree id="n45709" type="main" key="Suanenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suanenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Suana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suanetes: <entryFree id="n45710" type="main" key="Suanetes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suanetes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suani: <entryFree id="n45711" type="main" key="Suani"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suani</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:52" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 3, 15, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suardones: <entryFree id="n45712" type="main" key="Suardo_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suardōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe between the Oder and the Elbe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suari: <entryFree id="n45713" type="main" key="Sua_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suāri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of the Ganges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:94" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 23, 25, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suarius: <entryFree id="n45714" type="main" key="su^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n45714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging<cb n="SUAV" />  to swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swine-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45714.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 7, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45714.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45714.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n45714.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A swine-herd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45714.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A swine-dealer</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 4, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:27" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3672</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45714.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">traffic in swine</hi>, Edict. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 647, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suasani: <entryFree id="n45715" type="main" key="Suasani"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suasani</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Umbria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suasio: <entryFree id="n45716" type="main" key="sua_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suadeo</etym>, <sense id="n45716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counselling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45716.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:65" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 65</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni suasionum admonitionumque genere utens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:19:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 19, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45716.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45716.3" n="A" level="2"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">a recommending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advocacy</hi> of a proposed law: <cit><quote lang="la">suasio legis Serviliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 51, 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45716.4" n="B" level="2"> In rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">the suasory species of eloquence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 11, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta dare de suasionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:81:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 81, 333</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suasor: <entryFree id="n45717" type="main" key="sua_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45717.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one who exhorts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advises</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">persuades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an adviser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counsellor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuader</hi> (class.): esse suasorem summum et studiosum robore belli, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 375 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">me suasore et impulsore id factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suasor et impulsor profectionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid interest inter suasorem facti et probatorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suasoris finis est utilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:75" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45717.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">one who recommends</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advocates a proposed law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar legem tulit ut, etc.... suasore legis Pompeio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistola non suasoris sed rogatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, B, § 9.</sense></entryFree>
suasorius: <entryFree id="n45718" type="main" key="sua_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to counselling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">persuading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suasory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasive</hi> (post-Aug.). * </sense><sense id="n45718.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45718.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the suasory species of discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hortatory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suasory.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45718.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars deliberativa, quae eadem suasoria dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:48" default="NO">11, 1, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45718.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suāsōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. oratio), <hi rend="ital">a hortatory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suasory speech</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:8" default="NO">3, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:10" default="NO">3, 8, 10</bibl>; 3, 8, 20; 3, 8, 34; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 6</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suā-sōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">advisorily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1150</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
suasum: <entryFree id="n45719" type="main" key="sua_sum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. suadeo <sense id="n45719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45720" type="gloss" key="suasum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suasum</orth> <itype>colos appellatur</itype>, qui fit ex stillicidio fumoso in vestimento albo. Plautus (Truc. 2, 2, 16): <sense id="n45720.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quia tibi suaso infecisti, propudiosa, pallulam: quidam autem legunt in suaso (or insuaso). Nec desunt, qui dicant, omnem colorem, qui fiat inficiendo, suasum vocari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. insuasum, p. 111; cf. Salmas. Exerc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:page=245:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> p. 245, 2</bibl> c.</sense></entryFree>
suasus: <entryFree id="n45721" type="main" key="sua_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suadeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45722" type="main" key="sua_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>suadeo</etym>, <sense id="n45722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an advising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuading</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ob meum suasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vim, vel per suasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussu et increpitu ea expellens, non suasu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 8</bibl></cit> (but not <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 48</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
suatim: <entryFree id="n45723" type="gloss" key="su^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n45723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after the manner of swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swinishly</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 40, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suave: <entryFree id="n45724" type="main" key="sua_ve"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāve</orth>, adverb., v. suavis, I. <sense id="n45724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
suaveolens: <entryFree id="n45725" type="main" key="sua_ve^o^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĕ-ŏlens</orth> (also written separately), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suavis-oleo</etym>, <sense id="n45725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweet-smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amaracus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suaveolentia: <entryFree id="n45726" type="main" key="sua_ve^o^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĕŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suave-olens</etym>, <sense id="n45726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sweet odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrance</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suaviatio: <entryFree id="n45727" type="main" key="sua_vi^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sāv-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suavior</etym>, <sense id="n45727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kissing</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 63</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suavidicus: <entryFree id="n45728" type="hapax" key="sua_vi^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suavis-dico</etym>, <sense id="n45728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweet-spoken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 180</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suavifico: <entryFree id="n45729" type="main" key="sua_vi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>ātus, sum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n45729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. sem. dep.</hi> [suavis-facio], <hi rend="ital">to make acceptable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suavifragrantia: <entryFree id="n45730" type="main" key="sua_vi^fra_granti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭfrāgrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fragrance</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Serm. ad Neoph. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
suavillum: <entryFree id="n45731" type="main" key="sua_villum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvillum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sāv-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suavis</etym>, <sense id="n45731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sweet cake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 84, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suaviloquens: <entryFree id="n45732" type="main" key="sua_vi^lo^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭlŏquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suavisloquor</etym>, <sense id="n45732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweet-spoken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant-speaking</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): suaviloquenti ore Cetegus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl> (Ann. v. 304 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 31</bibl>; and v. suaviloquentia; so perh. in imitation of Ennius: jucunditas, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 7</bibl> (hence, expressly<cb n="SUAV" />  censured by Seneca as Ennian): <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:945" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 945</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suaviloquentia: <entryFree id="n45733" type="hapax" key="sua_vi^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suaviloquens</etym>, <sense id="n45733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetness of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suaviloquence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et oratorem appellat (Ennius Cethegum) et suaviloquentiam tribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. suaviloquens.</sense></entryFree>
suaviloquium: <entryFree id="n45734" type="main" key="sua_vi^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the speaking pleasant things</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mendac. 11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mendac. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suaviloquus: <entryFree id="n45735" type="gloss" key="sua_vi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suavis-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n45735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweet-spoken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, Inscr. Fratr. Arval. ap. Marin. p. 560: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suaviludius: <entryFree id="n45736" type="main" key="sua_vi^lu_di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭlūdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>suavis-ludus</etym>, <sense id="n45736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that delights in plays</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lover of plays</hi> (Tertullian): <cit><quote lang="la">defensio suaviludii, propter suaviludios nostros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 20</bibl></cit>; Cor. Mil. 6.</sense></entryFree>
suavio: <entryFree id="n45737" type="main" key="sua_vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sāvĭo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, v. suavior.</entryFree>
suaviolum: <entryFree id="n45738" type="main" key="sua_vi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭŏlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sāv-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>suavium</etym>, <sense id="n45738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little kiss</hi>, perh. only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:99:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 99, 2</bibl> and 14.</sense></entryFree>
suavior: <entryFree id="n45739" type="main" key="sua_vi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sāvĭor</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n45739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to kiss</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Atticam nostram cupio absentem suaviari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os oculosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n45739.1" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, Pompon. and Novat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45739.2" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a pass. signif., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suavis: <entryFree id="n45740" type="main" key="sua_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (sŭāves, trisyl., <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 274</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">a(d-, a(nda/nw</foreign>, to please; <foreign lang="greek">h(du/s</foreign>, sweet; Sanscr. svad-, taste; cf. suadeo</etym>, <sense id="n45740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grateful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightful</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: dulcis, jucundus). </sense><sense id="n45740.1" n="I" level="1"> As affecting the senses: <cit><quote lang="la">quod suave est aliis, aliis fit amarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor suavis et jucundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elixus esse quam assus soleo suavior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidimus et merulas poni et sine clune palumbes, Suaves res, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suaviores aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 11, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix suavissimi gustūs et odoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 64, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus unguenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi suavis daedala tellus Summittit flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima, Phaedr, 3, 1, 5: suavior et lenior color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 41, 65, § 140</bibl></cit>: sonus Egeriai, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.
