L. 7, § 42</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatio litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 453</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <itype>suave</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sweetly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suave locus voci resonat conclusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suave rubens hyacinthus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubenti Murice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45740.2" n="II" level="1"> As affecting the mind or feelings (cf.: gratus, jucundus): doctus, fidelis, Suavis homo, facundus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 250 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea suavis, amabilis, amoena Stephanium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes, benigni, faciles, suaves homines esse dicuntur, qui erranti comiter monstrant viam, benigne, non gravate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 16, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suavis, sicut fuit, videri maluit quam gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor suavissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nos conjunctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavis suaviatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc diem suavem Meum natalem agitemus amoenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—Suave est with <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rei servire suave est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi porro ut non sit suave vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suave, mari magno ... E terrā magnum alterius spectare laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: non quin mihi suavissimum sit ... tuae memoriae dare operam, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sweetly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightfully</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n45740.3" n="1" level="3"> To the senses: <cit><quote lang="la">video quam suaviter voluptas sensibus nostris blandiatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tam bene quam suaviter loquendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:29:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 29, 110</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavissime legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peucedanum odore suaviter gravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 70, § 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45740.4" n="2" level="3"> To the mind, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda jucunde ac suaviter meminerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula copiose et suaviter scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae suavissime scriptae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agis, dulcissime rerum? Suaviter, ut nunc est, inquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 71, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut tu amicissime et suavissime optas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1772" /> <cb n="SUB" /></sense></entryFree>
suavisonus: <entryFree id="n45741" type="main" key="sua_vi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suavis-sono</etym>, <sense id="n45741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweet-sounding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">echo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Fragm. Tr. v. 572" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Fragm. Tr. v. 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Melos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Fragm. Trag. v. 25" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Fragm. Trag. v. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suavitas: <entryFree id="n45742" type="main" key="sua_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suavis</etym>, <sense id="n45742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeableness</hi> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n45742.1" n="I" level="1"> To the senses: <cit><quote lang="la">is (piscis) habet suavitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid suavitatem piscium dicam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(muriatica) Sine omni lepore et sine suavitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tuus sonus et suavitas ista delectat: omitto verborum ... sed hanc dico suavitatem, quae erit ex ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa mirificā suavitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut conquirat undique suavitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 5, 23 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45742.2" n="II" level="1"> To the mind or feelings: <cit><quote lang="la">mira quaedam in cognoscendo suavitas et delectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem omnes amare meritissimo pro ejus eximiā suavitate debemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonum atque morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira carminibus dulcedo, mira suavitas, mira hilaritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter multas suavitates ingenii, officii, humanitatis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suaviter: <entryFree id="n45743" type="main" key="sua_vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. suavis <sense id="n45743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
suavitudo: <entryFree id="n45744" type="main" key="sua_vi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suavis</etym>, <sense id="n45744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight</hi> (very rare for the class. suavitas): cor meum, spes mea, mel meum, suavitudo, cibus, gaudium, <hi rend="ital">my sweet</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 173, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 14</bibl>; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 173, 5</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 110): <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 12, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitudinum mollitie capti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 22, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suavium: <entryFree id="n45745" type="main" key="sua_vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suāvĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sāvĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45745.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mouth</hi> puckered up to be kissed (anteclass. and very rare; syn. osculum): dum semihiulco savio meo puellum savior, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 53</bibl>; App M. 3, p. 135, 35.—</sense><sense id="n45745.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a love-kiss</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">fi/lhma</foreign> (mostly ante-class.; esp. freq. in Plaut.; syn.: osculum, basium; cf.: sciendum osculum religionis esse, savium voluptatis; <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis quidam osculum filiis dari, uxori basium, scorto savium dicant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 260</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">qui tuae non des amicae suavium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">da savium priusquam abis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">savium posco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saliendo sese exercebant magis quam scorto aut saviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">savia suavia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticae ... quoniam hilarula est, meis verbis suavium des,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">meus ocellus, meum labellum, mea salus, meum savium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 175</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 2, 178: mea salus, meum savium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sub: <entryFree id="n45746" type="main" key="su^b"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb</orth> (on the form sus from subs <sense id="n45746.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, III.), <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case> [perh. for es-ub, ens-ub, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ns</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">eis</foreign>) and <foreign lang="greek">u(po/</foreign>; Sanscr. upa; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 290" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 290</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">under.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45746.1" n="I" level="1"> With <case>abl.</case>, to point out the object under which a thing is situated or takes place (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(po/</foreign>, with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underneath.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45746.2" n="A" level="2"> Of space: <cit><quote lang="la">si essent, qui sub terrā semper habitavissent ... nec tamen exissent umquam supra terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub vestimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58</bibl>; cf.: saepe est sub palliolo sordido sapientia, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:23:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 23, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium ingens Inculto latet hoc sub corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub pellibus hiemare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manet sub Jove frigido Venator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub divo moreris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam sub divo agat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit> (v. divus, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">sub terrā vivi demissi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub hoc jugo dictator Aequos misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone (me) sub curru nimium propinqui Solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 21</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non parvum sub hoc verbo furtum latet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of lofty objects, at the foot of which, or in whose immediate neighborhood, any thing is situated, <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the foot of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub monte consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub monte considere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub colle constituere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub montis radicibus esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 36</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ipsis Numantiae moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ager sub urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 107</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SUB" /> 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Veteribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Novis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 70</bibl> Goer. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 59</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub basilicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub oculis domini suam probare operam studebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sub oculis erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem sub ipso ore urbis incendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.4" n="B" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sub ipsā profectione milites oppidum irrumperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub decessu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:49" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 494</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub eodem tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:491" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> al.— </sense><sense id="n45746.5" n="C" level="2"> In other relations, where existence under or in the immediate vicinity of any thing may be conceived. </sense><sense id="n45746.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Under</hi>, in rank or order; hence, <hi rend="ital">next to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately after</hi>: Euryalumque Helymus sequitur; <cit><quote lang="la">quo deinde sub ipso Ecce volat calcemque terit jam calce Diores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 322</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.7" n="2" level="3"> In gen., of subjection, domination, stipulation, influence, effect, reason, etc., <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ordine sub signis ducam legiones meas,</quote> <trans><tr>under my standards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 71</bibl></cit>: sub armis vitam cernere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 81</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 297 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub sarcinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub onere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n45746.8" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the power of; during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Veneris regno vapulo, non sub Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub regno esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub imperio alicujus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub dicione atque imperio alicujus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 66, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 7, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Corbulone Armenios pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: sub manu alicujus esse, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">sub rege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Hannibale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub dominā meretrice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub nutrice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub judice lis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipua sub Domitiano miseriarum pars erat,</quote> <trans><tr>during the reign of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsit sub Nerone novissimis annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gnarus sub Nerone temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub vulnere,</quote> <trans><tr>from the effects of the wound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub judice,</quote> <trans><tr>under</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo sub indice,</quote> <trans><tr>forced by no betrayer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 34</bibl></cit>.—So in certain phrases where the simple <case>abl.</case> is more freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub pacto abolitionis dominationem deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub condicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub condicionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub eā condicione, ne cui fidem meam obstringam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub eā condicione, si esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub condicione, ut (ne, si, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub specie (= specie, or per speciem): sub specie infidae pacis quieti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 45, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 24, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub tutelae specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 4, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub nomine pacis bellum latet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub alienis auspiciis rem gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lege, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub exceptione, si,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub poenā mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 36</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub frigido sudore mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n45746.9" n="II" level="1"> With <case>acc.</case>, to point out the object under which a thing comes, goes, extends, etc. (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(po/</foreign>, with <case>acc.</case>), <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45746.10" n="A" level="2"> Of space, usually with verbs of motion: <cit><quote lang="la">et datores et factores omnes subdam sub solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum sub vestimenta deferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tota se luna sub orbem solis subjecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum sub jugum mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 9</bibl> Dietsch ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub furcam ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub divum rapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 18, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub terras ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 654</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub judicium sapientis et delectum cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sub sensus subjecta sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sub aurium mensuram aliquam cadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae Ipsa sub ora viri venere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sub oculos venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with verb of rest: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid sub Noton et Borean hominum sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 364</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (cf. supra, I. A. 2.), of lofty objects, to the foot of which, or into whose immediate neighborhood, any thing comes, or near to which it extends, <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> <cb n="SUBA" /> <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub montem succedunt milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ipsum murum fons aquae prorumpebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:41" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missi sunt sub muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaei sub ipsos muros struxere aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes suas detulit sub Veliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arat finem sub utrumque colonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatus amnis Ostia sub Tusci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostem) mediam ferit ense sub alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub orientem secutus Armenios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.12" n="B" level="2"> Of time, denoting a close approximation. </sense><sense id="n45746.13" n="1" level="3"> Before, <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortly before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">until</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius sub noctem naves solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 662</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub vesperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 445</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lumina prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub tempus edendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub dies festos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub galli cantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque sub extremum brumae intractabilis imbrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra Visa sub obscurum noctis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima vel autumni sub frigora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (bellum) fuit sub recentem pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.14" n="2" level="3"> After, <hi rend="ital">immediately after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub eas (litteras) statim recitatae sunt tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub haec dicta omnes procubuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub adventum praetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub hanc vocem fremitus variantis multitudinis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub hoc erus inquit,</quote> <trans><tr>hereupon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.15" n="C" level="2"> In other relations, in which a coming under any thing may be conceived: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide hoc succedit sub manus negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>comes to hand</tr>, <tr>convenient</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub manus succedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: sub manum submittere, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convenient</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 36, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ictum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub manum annuntiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit> (al. sub manu; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra, I. C.): sub legum et judiciorum potestatem cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub populi Romani imperium dicionemque cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 12</bibl></cit> (1, 2): <cit><quote lang="la">incolas sub potestatem Atheniensium redigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium vos sub legis superbissimae vincula conicitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub unum fortunae ictum totas vires regni cadere pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.16" n="III" level="1"> In composition, the <hi rend="ital">b</hi> remains unchanged before vowels and before <hi rend="ital">b</hi>, <hi rend="ital">d</hi>, <hi rend="ital">j</hi>, <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, <hi rend="ital">n</hi>, <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, <hi rend="ital">v.</hi> Before <hi rend="ital">m</hi> and <hi rend="ital">r</hi> it is frequently, and before the remaining consonants, <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, <hi rend="ital">f</hi>, <hi rend="ital">g</hi>, <hi rend="ital">p</hi>, it is regularly assimilated. Yet here the MSS. vary, as in <hi rend="ital">ob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, etc. Before some words commencing with <hi rend="ital">c.</hi> <hi rend="ital">p</hi>, <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, it assumes the form <hi rend="ital">sus</hi>, by the rejection of the <hi rend="ital">b</hi> from a collateral form subs (analog. to abs); e. g. suscipio, suscito, suspendo, sustineo, sustuli, sustollo. Before <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, with a following consonant, there remains merely <hi rend="ital">su</hi> in the words suspicio, suspicor, suspiro; cf., however: substerno, substituo, substo, substruo al.; v. esp. Neue, Formenl. 2, 775 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n45746.17" n="B" level="2"> In composition, sub denotes, </sense><sense id="n45746.18" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, a being situated or contained under, a putting or bringing under, or a going in under any thing: subaeratus, subcavus; subdo, subigo, subicio; subhaereo, subaperio; subedo.—</sense><sense id="n45746.19" n="2" level="3"> Hence, also, a concealing or being concealed behind something; a secret action: subnoto, surripio, suffuror, subausculto, suborno. —</sense><sense id="n45746.20" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, a being placed or ranked under: subcenturio, subcurator, subcustos, etc.; or a being or doing any thing in a lower or inferior degree, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>: subabsurdus, subagrestis, subalbus, etc.; subaccusare, subirascor, etc.</sense></entryFree>
subabsurde: <entryFree id="n45747" type="main" key="su^babsurde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbabsurdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. subabsurdus <sense id="n45747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subabsurdus: <entryFree id="n45748" type="main" key="su^babsurdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-absurdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rather absurd</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">sunt illa subabsurda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subabsurda dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 71, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus discessūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incompositus, reconditus et, quo Cicero utitur, subabsurdus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:99" default="NO">6, 3, 99</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbabsurdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat absurdly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid subabsurde dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 275</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subaccuso: <entryFree id="n45749" type="main" key="su^baccu_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-accūso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accuse somewhat</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus discessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subaccusa quaeso Vestorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 46, 2</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1773" /> <cb n="SUBA" /></sense></entryFree>
subacer: <entryFree id="n45750" type="main" key="suba^ce^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-ăcĕr</orth>, <itype>acris, acre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sharp</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">gustus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subacidus: <entryFree id="n45751" type="main" key="su^ba^ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sourish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 108, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subactio: <entryFree id="n45752" type="main" key="su^bacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subigo</etym>. <sense id="n45752.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a working through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">working up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparing</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">harena fluviatica bacillorum subactionibus in tectorio recipit soliditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subactiones ciborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 107</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45752.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discipline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subacto mihi ingenio opus est ... subactio autem est usus, auditio, lectio, litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subactor: <entryFree id="n45753" type="main" key="su^bactor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a debaucher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polluter</hi> (syn. paedico; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Commod. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subactus: <entryFree id="n45754" type="main" key="su^bactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subigo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45755" type="hapax" key="su^bactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subigo</etym>, <sense id="n45755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a working up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kneading</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subadjuva: <entryFree id="n45756" type="main" key="su^badju^va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-adjŭva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>adjuvo</etym>, <sense id="n45756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assistant</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 6, 27, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 20, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subadmiratio: <entryFree id="n45757" type="main" key="su^badmi_ra_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-admīrātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">admiration</hi> (late Lat.), Dion. Exeg. Greg. Nyss. Creat. Hom. 10.</sense></entryFree>
subadmoveo: <entryFree id="n45758" type="main" key="su^badmo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-admŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring close</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:36:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 36, 4</bibl> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
subaduno: <entryFree id="n45759" type="main" key="su^ba^du_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ădūno</orth>, <itype>are, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unite</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 134, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subaemulatio: <entryFree id="n45760" type="main" key="su^baemu^la_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-aemŭlātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subaemulor</etym>, <sense id="n45760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secret rivalry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 36, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subaemulor: <entryFree id="n45761" type="main" key="su^baemu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-aemŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n45761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to accumulate secretly</hi>, Ambros. in. Psa. 36, § 10.</sense></entryFree>
subaeratus: <entryFree id="n45762" type="hapax" key="su^baera_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-aerātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has copper underneath</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">inside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:106" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subagitatio: <entryFree id="n45763" type="main" key="su^ba^gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbăgĭtātĭo, sŭbăgĭtātrix, sŭb-ăgĭto</orth>, v. subigitatio, etc.</entryFree>
subagrestis: <entryFree id="n45764" type="main" key="su^ba^grestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăgrestis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather boorish</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">subagreste quiddam planeque subrusticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalaris: <entryFree id="n45765" type="main" key="su^ba_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ālāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is under the arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carried under the arms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culcitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45765.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbālāres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the feathers under the wing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 4</bibl> Esd. 11, 25.—</sense><sense id="n45765.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbālāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an under-girdle</hi>, Edict. Diocl. p. 25; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subalbens: <entryFree id="n45766" type="hapax" key="su^balbens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-albens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whitish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prasinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalbicans: <entryFree id="n45767" type="hapax" key="su^balbi^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-albĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whitish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palea rubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalbidus: <entryFree id="n45768" type="main" key="su^balbi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-albĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather whitish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars corrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 25, 96, § 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 1, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subalbus: <entryFree id="n45769" type="hapax" key="su^balbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-albus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whitish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sabulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalpinus: <entryFree id="n45770" type="main" key="su^balpi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-alpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying near the Alps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sub-Alpine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 34, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalternicum: <entryFree id="n45771" type="hapax" key="su^balterni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbalternĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of reddish amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subamarus: <entryFree id="n45772" type="main" key="su^ba^ma_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ămārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat bitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bitterish</hi> (Ciceronian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 8</bibl>. —Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">subamarum arridens,</quote> <trans><tr>somewhat bitterly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subaperio: <entryFree id="n45773" type="main" key="su^ba^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăpĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to open from within</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nivem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auriculam sub cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7:section=372" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7, § 372</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subaquaneus: <entryFree id="n45774" type="hapax" key="su^ba^qua_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăquānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aqua</etym>, <sense id="n45774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belongs under water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sub-aqueous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterraneum et subaquaneum viventia carent haustu aëris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subaquilus: <entryFree id="n45775" type="main" key="su^ba^qui^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăquĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brownish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tawny</hi> (ante- and postclass.): corpus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 9</bibl>: vultus, Trebell. XXX. Tyr. 30.</sense></entryFree>
subarator: <entryFree id="n45776" type="hapax" key="su^ba^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ărātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who ploughs close to</hi> any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subarescens: <entryFree id="n45777" type="hapax" key="su^ba_rescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ārescens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aresco</etym>, <sense id="n45777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">growing somewhat dry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trullissatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subargutulus: <entryFree id="n45778" type="hapax" key="su^bargu_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-argūtŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat subtle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerably keen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:30:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 30, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subarmalis: <entryFree id="n45779" type="main" key="su^barma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-armālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>armus</etym>, <sense id="n45779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">passing under the arms</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestis (perh. thrown back under the arm),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 426</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbarmāle</orth>, is <gen>n.</gen>, = subarmalis vestis, Valer. ap. Treb. Claud. <cb n="SUBD" /> 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 13</bibl>; cf. subalaris.</sense></entryFree>
subaro: <entryFree id="n45780" type="main" key="su^ba^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăro</orth>, no <sense id="n45780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to plough close to</hi> any thing (Plinian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subarata ocius senescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 29, 51, § 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subarroganter: <entryFree id="n45781" type="hapax" key="su^barro^ganter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-arrŏganter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n45781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat proudly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arrogantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subasper: <entryFree id="n45782" type="hapax" key="su^basper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-asper</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughish</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">a)lfo/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subassentiens: <entryFree id="n45783" type="hapax" key="su^bassenti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-assentĭens</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>assentio</etym>, <sense id="n45783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">assenting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">yielding a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus subassentientibus umeris movetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subasso: <entryFree id="n45784" type="main" key="su^basso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-asso</orth>, no <sense id="n45784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to roast a little</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:2" default="NO">7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:5" default="NO">7, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 8: squilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subatio: <entryFree id="n45785" type="main" key="su^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subo</etym>, <sense id="n45785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brimming</hi> of swine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Prisc. Serm. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subaudio: <entryFree id="n45786" type="main" key="su^baudi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-audĭo</orth>, <itype>ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (postclass.). <sense id="n45786.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> a word omitted: <cit><quote lang="la">subaudito jubeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 7; 17, 11; Greg. M. in Job, 33, 17.—</sense><sense id="n45786.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hear a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnis subaudiens vocibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subauditio: <entryFree id="n45787" type="main" key="su^baudi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbaudītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subaudio</etym>, <sense id="n45787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplying</hi> a word omitted (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Quaest. Hebr. in Reg. 2, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subauratus: <entryFree id="n45788" type="main" key="su^baura_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-aurātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slightly gilt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32, 3</bibl></cit>: tabellae, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">STATVA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subausculto: <entryFree id="n45789" type="main" key="su^bausculto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ausculto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to listen secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eavesdrop</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subauscultando excipere voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:36:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 36, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprime os: is est, etiam subauscultemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tace, subauscultemus, ecquid de me fiat mentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videntur subauscultare quae loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viris subauscultantibus pariete interposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 20, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subausterus: <entryFree id="n45790" type="main" key="su^bauste_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-austērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather harsh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum austerum vel certe subausterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6, § 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6</bibl>. 8, § 68.</sense></entryFree>
subbalbe: <entryFree id="n45791" type="hapax" key="subbalbe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-balbē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>balbus</etym>, <sense id="n45791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat stammeringly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canorus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 5, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subballio: <entryFree id="n45792" type="main" key="Subballi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sub-ballĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Under - Ballio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sub - Ballio;</hi> a comically - formed name: <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Tune es Ballio? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Immo vero ego ejus sum Subballio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subbasilicanus: <entryFree id="n45793" type="hapax" key="subba^si^li^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-băsĭlĭcānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>basilica</etym>, <sense id="n45793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lounges around the basilicas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lounger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum odos subbasilicanos omnes abigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
subbibo: <entryFree id="n45794" type="main" key="subbi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-bĭbo</orth>, <itype>bĭbi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tipple</hi> (very rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 58</bibl> (dub.; Speng. si urnas bibit): si paulum subbibisset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subblandior: <entryFree id="n45795" type="main" key="subblandi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-blandĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype> (<sense id="n45795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> subblandibitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 19</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> subblandirier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 22</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to caress</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fondle a little</hi> (ante-class.): subblanditur, palpatur, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 472, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viris alienis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi inani atque inopi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subbrevis: <entryFree id="n45796" type="hapax" key="subbre^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-brĕvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather short</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium (saliuncae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 20, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subbullio: <entryFree id="n45797" type="main" key="subbulli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-bullĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to foam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bubble slightly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subc: <entryFree id="n45798" type="main" key="subc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>, v. succ-.</entryFree>
subdealbo: <entryFree id="n45799" type="hapax" key="subde^albo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dĕalbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to whiten a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make whilish</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 72, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdebilis: <entryFree id="n45800" type="hapax" key="subde_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dēbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat weak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enfeebled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdebilitatus: <entryFree id="n45801" type="hapax" key="subde_bi^li^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dēbĭlĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>debilito</etym>, <sense id="n45801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat enfeebled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">debilitated;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">somewhat discouraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather spiritless</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 5, 1</bibl> (dub.; better: subitā re quasi debilitatum, B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>
subdefectio: <entryFree id="n45802" type="main" key="subde_fecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdēfectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub - deficio</etym>, <sense id="n45802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight failure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Heptat. 6:30" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Heptat. 6, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdeficio: <entryFree id="n45803" type="main" key="subde_fi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dēfĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become more and more feeble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fail somewhat</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 343" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 343 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subdeligo: <entryFree id="n45804" type="main" key="subde_li^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdēlĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-deligo</etym>, <sense id="n45804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choose</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Categ. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Categ. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdescendo: <entryFree id="n45805" type="main" key="subdescendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdescendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sub-descendo</etym>, <sense id="n45805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to descend lower</hi> (late Lat.), Mar. Merc. Commonit. 4, 6.</sense></entryFree>
subdiaconus: <entryFree id="n45806" type="main" key="subdi^a^co^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dĭăcŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sub - deacon</hi>, <cb n="SUBD" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 53" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:63" default="NO">63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 12, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdialis: <entryFree id="n45807" type="main" key="subdi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dĭālis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">subdīvālis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 11, 4</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dius</etym>, <sense id="n45807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is in the open air</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">inambulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 12, 29, § 117</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subdĭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">open galleries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terraces;</hi> a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(pai/qria, u(/paiqra</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 186</bibl>.—Also in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdival domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdifficilis: <entryFree id="n45808" type="hapax" key="subdiffi^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-diffĭcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat difficult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdiffido: <entryFree id="n45809" type="hapax" key="subdiffi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-diffīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be somewhat distrustful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdimidius: <entryFree id="n45810" type="hapax" key="subdi_mi^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dīmĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, of a number, <sense id="n45810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half as much less</hi>, <hi rend="ital">less by one half of itself</hi> (i. e. that bears to another the ratio of 2 to 3): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus (opp. superdimidius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 761</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdisjunctio: <entryFree id="n45811" type="main" key="subdisjuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-disjunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, gram. t. t., <sense id="n45811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a minor stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 432</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
subdisjunctivus: <entryFree id="n45812" type="main" key="subdisjuncti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-disjunctīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subdisjunctive;</hi> said of two statements opposed to each other in such a way that neither of them may hold good (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec verba: ille aut ille, non solum disjunctiva sed etiam subdisjunctivae orationis sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:124" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1029</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
subdistinguo: <entryFree id="n45813" type="main" key="subdistinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-distinguo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a smaller interpunction</hi> (perh. <hi rend="ital">a colon</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 2, 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
