cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova res subito mihi haec objecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita abripuit repente sese subito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito tanta te impendent mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot bella subito atque improviso nascantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 19, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oculis subito fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum subito ecce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut subito nostras Hymen cantatus ad aures Venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito deficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod serenā nocte subito candens et plena luna defecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus subito timor omnem exercitum occupavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito opprimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vespertinus subito te oppresserit hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit> et. saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">subito dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>without preparation</tr>, <tr>extempore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vox et gestus subito sumi non potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 59, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque potest quisquam nostrum subito fingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 25, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid subito ex tempore conjectura explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:12" default="NO">11, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventa (opp. domo allata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum subito evaserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam subito copias contrahere non potuit,</quote> <trans><tr>so quickly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suber: <entryFree id="n45845" type="main" key="su_ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūber</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cork-oak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cork-tree</hi>: Quercus suber, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:98" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 25, 41, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:6:1" default="NO">9, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 742</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45845.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">cork</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 554</bibl></cit>; cf.: ut ramale vetus vegrandi subere coctum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a thick bark</hi>, like that of the cork-tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:97" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 97</bibl>.—The tree is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūbĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=294" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 294</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suberectus: <entryFree id="n45846" type="main" key="su^be_rectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbērectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suberigo.</entryFree>
subereus: <entryFree id="n45847" type="main" key="su_be^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūbĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suber</etym>, <sense id="n45847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the cork-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cork-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 34, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
suberies: <entryFree id="n45848" type="main" key="su_be^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūbĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, v. suber.</entryFree>
suberigo: <entryFree id="n45849" type="main" key="sube_ri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-ērĭgo</orth>, no <sense id="n45849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi> from below (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Isthmon curvata sublime suberigit unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:155" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effultus in cubitum suberectusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suberinus: <entryFree id="n45850" type="main" key="su_be^ri_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūbĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suber</etym>, <sense id="n45850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the cork-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cork</hi>- (syn. subereus): <cit><quote lang="la">cortices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45851" type="main" key="Su_be^ri_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūbĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. suberinus</etym>, <sense id="n45851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suberro: <entryFree id="n45852" type="hapax" key="su^berro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-erro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wander about under</hi> any thing: fluvii Italis suberrant Montibus, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 254.</sense></entryFree>
subertani: <entryFree id="n45853" type="main" key="Suberta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Subertāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Subertum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the modern Sovretto in Tuscany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Subertānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Subertani</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subex: <entryFree id="n45854" type="main" key="su^bex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. subices.</entryFree>
subexcuso: <entryFree id="n45855" type="main" key="su^bexcu_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-excūso</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to excuse in part</hi>, Salv. Gub. Dei, 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
subexhibeo: <entryFree id="n45856" type="hapax" key="su^bexhi^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-exhĭbĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exhibit under</hi> any thing, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subexplicans: <entryFree id="n45857" type="main" key="su^bexpli^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-explĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [explico], <sense id="n45857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfolding below</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">non pedibus se ferens neque suas subexplicans itiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 251</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subf: <entryFree id="n45858" type="main" key="subf"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>, v. suff-.</entryFree>
subg: <entryFree id="n45859" type="main" key="subg"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>, v. sugg-.</entryFree>
subhaereo: <entryFree id="n45860" type="hapax" key="su^bhaere^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-haerĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stick under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behind; to cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere to</hi> a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subhastarius: <entryFree id="n45861" type="main" key="su^bhasta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbhastārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-hasta</etym>, <sense id="n45861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is sold by public auction</hi> (jurid. Lat.): possessiones, Cod. Th. 13, 6, 9.</sense></entryFree>
subhastatio: <entryFree id="n45862" type="main" key="su^bhasta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbhastātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subhasto</etym>, <sense id="n45862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sale by public auction</hi> (late Lat. for venditio palam habita), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 44, 16</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 17, 3.</sense></entryFree>
subhasto: <entryFree id="n45863" type="main" key="su^bhasto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-hasto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-hasta</etym>, <sense id="n45863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sell by public auction</hi> (jurid. Lat. for hastae subicio, palam vendo): res pignori datas. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 53, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subheres: <entryFree id="n45864" type="gloss" key="su^bhe_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-hēres</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-haeres</orth>), <itype>ēdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the next</hi> or <hi rend="ital">second heir</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">heres secundus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3612</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subhorresco: <entryFree id="n45865" type="hapax" key="su^bhorresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-horresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become rough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stormy</hi> from below, <hi rend="ital">to boil up</hi>: subito mare subhorrescere, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 423, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subhorridus: <entryFree id="n45866" type="hapax" key="su^bhorri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-horrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subhorridus atque incultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subhumidus: <entryFree id="n45867" type="main" key="su^bhu_mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-hūmĭdus</orth>, v. subumidus. <pb n="1776" /> <cb n="SUBI" /></entryFree>
subi: <entryFree id="n45868" type="main" key="Subi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Subi</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, <sense id="n45868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Subis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subices: <entryFree id="n45869" type="main" key="su^bi^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subicio</etym>, <sense id="n45869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">underlayers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supports</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ennius in tragoediā, quae Achilles inscribitur, pro aëre alto ponit, qui caelo subjectus est, in his versibus: per ego deum sublimas subices umidas, Unde oritur imber, sonitu saevo et strepitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 17, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=305" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 305</bibl> Müll., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 33</bibl> (Trag. v. 5 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
subicio: <entryFree id="n45870" type="main" key="su_bi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūb-ĭcĭo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">subjĭcĭo</orth>; post-Aug. sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-</orth>), <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-jacio</etym>. <sense id="n45870.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near</hi> (cf. subdo); in all senses construed with <case>acc.</case> and <case>dat.</case>, or with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">sub</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> not with <hi rend="ital">sub</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (v. Madvig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 48</bibl>; cf. II. B. 2. infra). </sense><sense id="n45870.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: si parum habet lactis mater, ut subiciat (agnum) sub alterius mammam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum ventri et sub femina (boum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: nonnulli inter carros rotasque mataras ac tragulas subiciebant, <hi rend="ital">discharged their javelins and darts below</hi>, i. e. between the wagons and the wheels, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">biremes, subjectis scutulis, subduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna et sarmenta circumdare ignemque circum subicere coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes tectis ac moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Afr. 87, 1; 91, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:229 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 229 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 35, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia pallae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburnea collo Bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuto sinistram, Canitiem galeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxiorem sinum sinistro bracchio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:146" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova gallinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 62, § 231</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:161" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 59, 79, § 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tota se luna sub orbem solis subjecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa subjecta corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 139</bibl></cit> et saep: <cit><quote lang="la">sub aspectum omnium rem subicit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res sub oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves sub umbriferas rupes,</quote> <trans><tr>to place near</tr>, <tr>close to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem suam castris Scipionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se iniquis locis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw up with the share</tr>, <tr>to plough up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit> Moser <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: corpora saltu Subiciunt in equos, <hi rend="ital">throw up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 288</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidum regem in equum,</quote> <trans><tr>to set</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me e postremo in tertium locum esse subjectum,</quote> <trans><tr>have been brought</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Toga Cand. Fragm. p. 522</bibl></cit> Orell.: copias integras vulneratis defessisque subiciebat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">put in the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substituted</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 26, 2.—Hence (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): se subicere, <hi rend="ital">to mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum vere novo viridis se subicit alnus,</quote> <trans><tr>shoots up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus Parva sub ingenti matris se subicit umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 19</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n45870.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45870.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hand to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei libellum malus poëta de populo subjecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse manu subicit gladios ac tela ministrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 574</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45870.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To substitute</hi> false for true; <hi rend="ital">to forge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">suppono, substituo): testamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupleti falsum testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes pro auro in pignore dando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45870.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To suborn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subicitur L. Metellus ab inimicis Caesaris, qui hanc rem distrahat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes frequenter subici ab adversario solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitione subjecti petitoris non carebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n45870.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45870.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n45870.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To submit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae sub sensus subjecta sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res, quae subjectae sunt sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationi aliquid subicere,</quote> <trans><tr>submit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">ait (Epicurus), eos neque intellegere neque videre, sub hanc vocem honestatis quae sit subicienda sententia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>what meaning is to be attributed to it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit> B. and K.; Madvig. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic verbo (voluptas) omnes qui Latine sciunt duas res subiciunt, laetitiam in animo, commotionem suavem jucunditatis in corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico eum non intellegere interdum, quid sonet haec vox voluptatis, id est, quae res huic voci subiciatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: quaeritur, <cb n="SUBI" /> quae res ei (nomini) subicienda sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45870.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To substitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutata, in quibus pro verbo proprio subicitur aliud, quod idem significet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 92</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud pro eo, quod neges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 74</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n45870.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45870.11" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to place under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subiciunt se homines imperio alterius et potestati,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>submit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exteras gentes servitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albius et Atrius quibus vos subjecistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alter alterius imperio subiceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentem suam dicioni nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:37" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 37</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia securibus subjecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia praeter eam (virtutem) subjecta, sunt sub fortunae dominationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 17, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos sub eorum potestatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 31, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matribus familias sub hostilem libidinem subjectis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub aspectus omnium rem subjecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos penatis subjectos esse libidini tribuniciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:40:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 40, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum senatui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si virtus subjecta sub varios incertosque casus famula fortunae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod sub eam vim subjectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 15, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus victus vestitusque necessarius sub praeconem subjectus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona civium voci praeconis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23</bibl></cit>. 83; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, simply reliquias spectaculorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to expose for sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">delatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemi navigationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to subject</tr>, <tr>expose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus fraudemque nocentis odio civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas innocentium fictis auditionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid calumniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45870.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To subject</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subordinate</hi> a particular to a general, <hi rend="ital">to range</hi> or <hi rend="ital">treat</hi> it <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">append</hi> it <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, etc.; in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be ranged under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">comprised in</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor partes, quae subiciuntur sub vocabulum recti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">unum quodque genus exemplorum sub singulos artis locos subicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formarum certus est numerus, quae cuique generi subiciantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vocabulum sive appellationem nomini subjecerunt tamquam speciem ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub metum subjecta sunt pigritia, pudor, terror, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas, justum, etc. ... subici possunt honestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere apte plerique ornatui subiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n45870.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To place under</hi> in succession or order, in speaking or writing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to place after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">append</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">addo, adicio): post orationis figuras tertium quendam subjecit locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longis (litteris) breves subicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">B litterae absonam et ipsam S subiciendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationem prooemio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur sic opinetur, rationem subicit,</quote> <trans><tr>adds</tr>, <tr>subjoins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 50, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod subicit, Pompeianos esse a Sullā impulsos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibusdam senatoribus subjectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subicit Scrofa: De formā culturae hoc dico, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non exspectare responsum et statim subicere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicto subjecisti, quid in utrumque vestrum esset impensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix pauca furenti Subicio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>answer</tr>, <tr>reply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 314</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45870.14" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To comprehend under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">embrace in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quam res disperse et diffuse dictae unum sub aspectum subiciuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:52:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 52, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45870.15" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adduce; to bring to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggest</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si meministi id, quod olim dictum est, subice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio mihi ab illo subici, si quid forte praetereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subiciens, quid dicerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dolor querentibus subicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:18" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tibi subiciet carmina serus amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes est Peliā subjecta creatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 304</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-jectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n45870.16" n="A" level="2"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">lying under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bordering upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighboring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjacent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter (cingulus terrae) subjectus aquiloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heraclea, quae est subjecta Candaviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivus castris Scipionis subjectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subjectus viae campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 38</bibl></cit>: Armenia subjecta suo regno (opp. Cappadocia longius remota), Auct. B. Alex. 35, 2; 28, 3: genae deinde ab inferiore parte tutantur subjectae, Cic. N. D. <cb n="SUBI" /> 2, 57, 143.—</sense><sense id="n45870.17" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Subjected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem Ea (natura deorum) subjecta est ei necessitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:30:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 30, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subjectior in diem et horam Invidiae,</quote> <trans><tr>exposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">species, quae sunt generi subjectae,</quote> <trans><tr>subordinate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum neque subjectus solito nec blandior esto,</quote> <trans><tr>submissive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 411</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parcere subjectis et debellare superbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 853</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-jectus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inferior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vilicus), qui, quid aut qualiter faciendum sit, ab subjecto discit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:25" default="NO">11, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridates ab omnibus subjectis singula exquirens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45870.18" n="C" level="2"> In the later philos. and gram. lang.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subjec-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. verbum), <hi rend="ital">that which is spoken of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the foundation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subject</hi> of a proposition: <cit><quote lang="la">omne quicquid dicimus aut subjectum est aut de subjecto aut in subjecto est. Subjectum est prima substantia, quod ipsum nulli accidit alii inseparabiliter, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 361</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 34, 4</bibl> et saep.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectē</orth> (cf. B. supra), <hi rend="ital">humbly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submissively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quam potest demississime et subjectissime exponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subicitare: <entryFree id="n45871" type="main" key="su^bi^ci^ta_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭcĭtāre</orth>, v. subigito, I.</entryFree>
subiculum: <entryFree id="n45872" type="spur" key="su^bi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭcŭlum</orth>, a false read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 14</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
subidus: <entryFree id="n45873" type="hapax" key="su^bi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n45873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sensible</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 11</bibl> (dub.; Hertz, subitus).</sense></entryFree>
subigitatio: <entryFree id="n45874" type="hapax" key="su^bi^gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭgĭtātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sŭbăgĭt-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subigito</etym>, <sense id="n45874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">illicit intercourse</hi>, Plaut. Capt. cat. 2.</sense></entryFree>
subigitatrix: <entryFree id="n45875" type="hapax" key="su^bi^gi^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭgĭtātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sŭbăgĭt-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that indulges in illicit intercourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lascivious woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subigito: <entryFree id="n45876" type="main" key="su^bi^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭgĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sŭbăgĭto</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>sub-agito</etym>. <sense id="n45876.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lie with illicitly</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">scortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 53</bibl></cit> (649 Ritschl): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 2</bibl> (al. subicitare); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45876.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to work upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi> to any thing (post-class.): aliquem, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem blanditiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 329, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subigo: <entryFree id="n45877" type="main" key="su^bi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype> (sūbĭgĭt, scanned with u long, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 47, 106), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-ago</etym>, <sense id="n45877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get under; bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get up</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">up to</hi> any place. </sense><sense id="n45877.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sues antequam aestus incipiat, subigunt in umbrosum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui adverso flumine lembum Remigiis subigit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rows up stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad castellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem ad moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:218" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum contra ardua montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:610" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondosum apicem ad sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:641" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 641</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">celsos sonipedes ocius subigit jugo,</quote> <trans><tr>brings under the yoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1002" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1002</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to lie with</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45877.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to turn up from beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dig up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivate; to work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knead; to rub down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharpen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whet; to tame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. domo): terram ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum subigere oportet bene: ubi erit subactus, areas facito,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn over and over</tr>, <tr>turn up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 161, 1</bibl></cit>: segetes aratris, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 401, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum bipalio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomere terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 125</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratem conto,</quote> <trans><tr>to work</tr>, <tr>move</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontum remis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to plough</tr>, <tr>furrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:471" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farinam in mortarium indito, aquae paulatim addito subigitoque pulchre: ubi bene subegeris, defingito,</quote> <trans><tr>knead it thoroughly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 74</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corium pilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 7</bibl></cit>: harenam argillae usque ad lentorem, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 10, 44, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subigunt in cote secures,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sharpen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressa manu (pecudum) terga,</quote> <trans><tr>to rub down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(beluam) facilem ad subigendum frenat,</quote> <trans><tr>easy to be tamed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 40, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vitulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45877.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45877.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjugate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, etc. (freq. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">plerique omnes subiguntur sub suum judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Bell. Pan. Fr. Inc. 7" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Bell. Pan. Fr. Inc. 7</bibl></cit> (p. 18 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Persas, Paphlagonas ... subegit solus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: tertiam partem orbis terrarum, Cic. <pb n="1777" /> <cb n="SUBI" /> Rosc. Am. 36, 103: <cit><quote lang="la">quos armis subegimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Balb. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia devicta et subacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes atque nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam inter Alpes fretumque Italiam armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:26:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae consuetudine subigere aures populi debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:11:130" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 11, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:38" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulos,</quote> <trans><tr>to break in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos subactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victi ac subacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 16, 36</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: mors amici subigit, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 22</bibl>.—In mal. part. (cf. signif. I.): Gallias Caesar subegit, Nicomedes Caesarem, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45877.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel; to force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrain</hi> to any thing; constr. with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in aliquid;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subegi, fenore argentum ab danistā ut sumeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu me numquam subiges, redditum ut reddam tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subigor, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec subigi queantur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ederet socios, subigi non potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestate stipendii ad deditionem subigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deditionem Volscos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes ad deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes metu subactae in dicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes fame in deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis subegit verum fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquiniensem metu subegerat frumentum exercitui praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subegit socios ignotae linquere terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitio multos mortalis falsos fieri subegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria te subegit decernere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiis subactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 494</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45877.6" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To cultivate</hi>, of the mind; <hi rend="ital">to train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discipline</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">subacto mihi ingenio opus est, ut agro non semel arato sed novato et iterato, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subacti atque durati bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subigus: <entryFree id="n45878" type="main" key="Su^bi^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbĭgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subigo, I.</etym>, <sense id="n45878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tutelary god of the wedding-night</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9.</sense></entryFree>
subimpleo: <entryFree id="n45879" type="main" key="su^bimple^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbimplĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-impleo</etym>, <sense id="n45879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill up</hi>, Aug. c. Epist. Manich. 22, 24.</sense></entryFree>
subimpudens: <entryFree id="n45880" type="hapax" key="su^bimpu^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-impŭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat shameless</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impudent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subinanis: <entryFree id="n45881" type="hapax" key="su^bi^na_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ĭnānis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat empty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est subinane in nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subinde: <entryFree id="n45882" type="main" key="su^binde"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-inde</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, a particle of time. <sense id="n45882.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">immediately after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereupon</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">primum gaudere, subinde Praeceptum auriculis hoc instillare memento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager primum aretur ultimā parte mensis Augusti, subinde Septembri sit iteratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo auctumno arandi et subinde conserendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparge subinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud subinde bellum cum alterius orae Graecis ortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 25, 1</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">semperne eosdem an subinde alios?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae subinde urbes captae direptaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem suis liberis subinde dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45882.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of repeated actions, <hi rend="ital">one after the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from time to time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now and then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continually</hi> (cf. interdum): <cit><quote lang="la">praedae minus inventum est, quod subinde spolia agrorum capta domos mittebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subinde exsecuntur legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae subinde nuntiata sunt regi, continuae felicitati rerum ejus imposuerant labem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si diligenter subinde emundata fuerit humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragicum illud subinde jactabat: Oderint dum metuant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit pergratum mihi hanc effigiem ejus subinde intueri, subinde respicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentitur tua subinde tussis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:39:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 39, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subindico: <entryFree id="n45883" type="main" key="su^bindi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-indĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to indicate slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hint at</hi> (late Lat.), Mar. Marc. Cyril. Incarn. Unigen. 31.</sense></entryFree>
subindo: <entryFree id="n45884" type="main" key="su^bindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-indo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to subjoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Rom. 3:section=7" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Rom. 3, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subinfero: <entryFree id="n45885" type="main" key="su^binfe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-infĕro</orth>, <itype>tŭli, ferre</itype>, <sense id="n45885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irreg. v. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to subjoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Genes. Litt. 3:24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Genes. Litt. 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Pet. 1, 5.</sense></entryFree>
subinflo: <entryFree id="n45886" type="main" key="su^binflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-inflo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to puff up somewhat; pass.</hi> subinflari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:4:71" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 4, 71</bibl>.—Rare, except in <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat puffed up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inflated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 46</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SUBJ" /></sense></entryFree>
subinfluo: <entryFree id="n45887" type="spur" key="su^binflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-inflŭo</orth>, a false read. for subterfluant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 4</bibl>.</entryFree>
subinjectus: <entryFree id="n45888" type="hapax" key="su^binjectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-injectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [inicio], <sense id="n45888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laid down upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subinjectā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subinscribo: <entryFree id="n45889" type="main" key="su^binscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-inscrībo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pareggra/fw</foreign>, <sense id="n45889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to subjoin</hi>, Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1208 B.</sense></entryFree>
subinsulsus: <entryFree id="n45890" type="hapax" key="su^binsulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-insulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat tasteless</hi> or <hi rend="ital">insipid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid absurdum ... aut subinsulsum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subintellego: <entryFree id="n45891" type="main" key="su^bintelle^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-intellĕgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to understand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perceive a little</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 145 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45891.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To supply</hi> in thought, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi> in addition, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 104:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Serm. 104, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Greg. M. in Job, 33, 7 al.</sense></entryFree>
subintro: <entryFree id="n45892" type="main" key="su^bintro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-intro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go into secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter by stealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steal into</hi> (late Lat.); trop.: populo bellicoso ludorum scenicorum subintravit insania, Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 32; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
subintroduco: <entryFree id="n45893" type="main" key="su^bintro_du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-intrōdūco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to introduce in secret</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 137" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subintroeo: <entryFree id="n45894" type="main" key="su^bintro^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-intrŏĕo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subintroire speciem alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subintromitto: <entryFree id="n45895" type="main" key="su^bintro_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbintrōmitto</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-intromitto</etym>, <sense id="n45895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">introduced temporarily</hi>, Facund. Defens. 9, 1 (probably an error for subintermitto).</sense></entryFree>
subinvideo: <entryFree id="n45896" type="main" key="su^binvi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-invĭdĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n45896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n45896.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To envy a little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be somewhat envious of</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">subinvideo tibi, ultro te etiam arcessitum ab eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45896.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little disliked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat odious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subinvisum apud malevolos Postumi nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subinvito: <entryFree id="n45897" type="hapax" key="su^binvi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-invīto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to invite slightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem, ut ad se scriberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subirascor: <entryFree id="n45898" type="main" key="su^bi_rascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-īrascor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n45898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be somewhat angry</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">interdum soleo subirasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitati litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Epirum quod me non invitas, subirascor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbīrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat angry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus subiratior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154</bibl></cit> (dub. al. iratior).</sense></entryFree>
subis: <entryFree id="n45899" type="main" key="subis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bird that breaks eagles' eggs</hi>, otherwise unknown, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 14, 17, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n45900" type="main" key="Subis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Subis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Subi.</entryFree>
subitaneus: <entryFree id="n45901" type="main" key="su^bi^ta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭtānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subitus</etym>, <sense id="n45901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sudden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:4" default="NO">2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:22:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subitarius: <entryFree id="n45902" type="main" key="su^bi^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">done suddenly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum exercitum explendum Latini Hernicique dare Quintio subitarios milites (ita tum repentina auxilia appellabant) jussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">milites (corresp. to tumultuarii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 30, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus theatri (with scena in tempus structa),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictio,</quote> <trans><tr>a speaking extempore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:15:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst. n.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitaria ista nostra,</quote> <trans><tr>off-hand sayings</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subitatio: <entryFree id="n45903" type="main" key="su^bi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suddenness</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subito: <entryFree id="n45904" type="main" key="su^bi^to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭtō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. subeo, <sense id="n45904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subitum: <entryFree id="n45905" type="main" key="su^bi^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. subitus, 2. s. v. subeo <sense id="n45905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subitus: <entryFree id="n45906" type="main" key="su^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>subeo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
subjacentia: <entryFree id="n45907" type="main" key="subja^centia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjăcentia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-jaceo</etym>, <sense id="n45907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the being a subject</hi> (philos. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">to\ u(pokei=sqai</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">omni qualitate remotā ipsum subjacentiae solius punctum contuetur,</quote> <trans><tr>absolute objectiveness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Orig. Princ. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subjaceo: <entryFree id="n45908" type="main" key="subja^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-jăcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near</hi> any thing (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n45908.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">feles coeunt mare stante, feminā subjacente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum si tegulis subjaceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestris subjacet vestibulum villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subjacentes petrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus aedificio subjacet,</quote> <trans><tr>adjoins</tr>, <tr>lies close to the building</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">monti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestra subjacens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45908.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject to</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to belong to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be connected with</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">causa, cui plurimae subjacent lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 27</bibl></cit>;
