cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subjacet utilitati etiam illa defensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantitas plerumque eidem (qualitati) subjacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SUBJ" /> 4, 41: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones velut subjacentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 91</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vita, quae multis casibus subjacet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 266, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopes divitum impotentiae subjacentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 28, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viliores personae capitali supplicio subjaceant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ditioni regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Esth. 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex materiā subjacente (deo) ac paratā,</quote> <trans><tr>within his power</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subjacto: <entryFree id="n45909" type="main" key="subjacto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjacto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. subjecto <sense id="n45909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subjecte: <entryFree id="n45910" type="main" key="subjecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. subicio, <sense id="n45910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subjectibilis: <entryFree id="n45911" type="main" key="subjecti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subicio</etym>, <sense id="n45911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">submissive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subjectio: <entryFree id="n45912" type="main" key="subjecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putting</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">placing under.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45912.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45912.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum sub aspectum paene subjectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius rei sub oculos subjectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45912.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45912.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A representation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45912.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A substituting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45912.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A subjugation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduction to obedience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 12, § <cit><quote lang="la">27: in omni subjectione,</quote> <trans><tr>in all submissiveness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">the state of slavery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> Get. 32</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45912.7" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an annexing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoining.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45912.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 17, 24</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45912.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., rhet. t. t. </sense><sense id="n45912.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An answer subjoined</hi> by an orator to a question which he has just asked, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 23, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 98</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45912.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An added explanation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 18, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subjective: <entryFree id="n45913" type="main" key="subjecti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. subjectivus.</entryFree>
subjectivus: <entryFree id="n45914" type="main" key="subjecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subjectus</etym>, <sense id="n45914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the subject</hi> of a proposition, <hi rend="ital">subjective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 30, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 393</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">subjectively</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 393</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subjecto: <entryFree id="n45915" type="main" key="subjecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjecto</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">subjacto</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52, 2</bibl>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>subicio</etym>, <sense id="n45915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">put under</hi>; <hi rend="ital">to throw out from below</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acres Subjectat lasso stimulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigram alte harenam,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast up from its depths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 241</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">grana e terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subjector: <entryFree id="n45916" type="hapax" key="subjector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who substitutes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a substitutor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subjectum: <entryFree id="n45917" type="main" key="subjectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. subicio, II. C.</entryFree>
subjectus: <entryFree id="n45918" type="main" key="subjectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from subicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45919" type="main" key="subjectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subicio</etym>, <sense id="n45919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying under</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 15, 90, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subjicio: <entryFree id="n45920" type="main" key="subji^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjĭcĭo</orth>, v. subicio.</entryFree>
subjugalis: <entryFree id="n45921" type="hapax" key="subju^ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-jŭgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">accustomed to the yoke</hi>: subjugales beluae, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 333.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a beast of burden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subjugator: <entryFree id="n45922" type="main" key="subju^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjŭgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subjugo</etym>, <sense id="n45922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who brings under the yoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a conqueror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjugator</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ORBIS TERRARVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 838</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2</bibl></cit>, pp. 16, 17.</sense></entryFree>
subjugius: <entryFree id="n45923" type="main" key="subju^gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjŭgĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-jugum</etym>, <sense id="n45923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the yoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is attached to the yoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subjŭ-gĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> (sc. lora), <hi rend="ital">yoke-straps</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subjugo: <entryFree id="n45924" type="main" key="subju^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjŭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (postclass.) <sense id="n45924.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring under the yoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus publicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45924.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjugate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ORBEM TERRAE ROMANO NOMINI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 281, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 249</bibl></cit>: provinciam, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 1:21" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi periculo subjugati sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 34</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem poenae, Dig 4, 8, 43: aliquem personali muneri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50</bibl></cit> 4, 18, § <cit><quote lang="la">9: ingratum populum legi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum hominem alienae dicioni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes servituti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subjugus: <entryFree id="n45925" type="main" key="subju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> * <sense id="n45925.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That is attached to the yoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yoked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molae machinariae subjugum aliquem dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45925.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">subjŭgum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of an unknown animal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eïdem auctores subjugum, quod nec quale esset animal, nec ubi nasceretur, tradiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 52, § 146</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1778" /> <cb n="SUBL" /></sense></entryFree>
subjunctivus: <entryFree id="n45926" type="main" key="subjuncti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjunctīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subjungo</etym>, <sense id="n45926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to binding together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connecting;</hi> in the later gram. lang., modus, <hi rend="ital">the subjunctive mood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 331</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 820</bibl> ib. al.: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctiones, e. g. si, cum, antequam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 200 sq.</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 561</bibl></cit> ib.</sense></entryFree>
subjunctorium: <entryFree id="n45927" type="main" key="subjuncto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjunctōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carriage drawn by animals</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 10.—</sense><sense id="n45927.1" n="II" level="1"> = <foreign lang="greek">u(pozu/gion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a beast used for draught</hi>, Ambros. Interp. Job et Dav. 2, 5, § 20.</sense></entryFree>
subjunctus: <entryFree id="n45928" type="main" key="subjunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subjunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subjungo.</entryFree>
subjungo: <entryFree id="n45929" type="main" key="subjungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-jungo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n45929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> subjungier, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:586" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 586</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to yoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harness</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">curru subjungere tigres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(juvencos) plostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpento suo equas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 49, 109, § 262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45929.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n45929.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">add to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to annex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n45929.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneia puppis ... rostro Phrygios subjuncta leones,</quote> <trans><tr>having affixed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45929.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subordinate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sub suom judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu fac utrumque uno subjungas nomine eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes artes oratori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles translationi haec ipsa subjungit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calliope haec percussis subjungit carmina nervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod memoriam quidam inventioni, quidam dispositioni subjunxerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have associated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and postAug., of speech, <hi rend="ital">to add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo idem verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quae sit narrandi ratio subjungam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subjunxit egregiam causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: quid praeterea novi? Nihil; <cit><quote lang="la">alioqui subjungerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; 5, 7, 4; 5, 14, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 33, 7: at ille subjunxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45929.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjugate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">urbes multas sub imperium populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:section=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes sub vestrum jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 36, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli fas Italo tantam subjungere gentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novas provincias imperio nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:39:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi res, non me rebus subjungere conor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45929.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay under</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">immortalia fundamenta rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:862" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 862</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45929.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put in the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempta una littera sonitus vastioris et subjuncta levioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublabium: <entryFree id="n45930" type="hapax" key="subla^bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublăbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sub-labium</etym>, <sense id="n45930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dog's-tongue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sublabor: <entryFree id="n45931" type="main" key="subla_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n45931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glide</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sink under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n45931.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperfecta necesse est labent et modo prodeant, modo sublabantur aut succidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:section=34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia vetustate sublapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:75:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 75, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">annis sublapsa vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 686</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45931.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to slip down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glide away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lues udo sublapsa veneno Pertentat sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 354</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45931.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro sublapsa Spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria senum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 817" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 817</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublabro: <entryFree id="n45932" type="hapax" key="subla^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lăbro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>labrum</etym>, <sense id="n45932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put into the mouth</hi>, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sublacensis: <entryFree id="n45933" type="main" key="Subla^censis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sublăcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Sublaqueum.</entryFree>
sublacrimans: <entryFree id="n45934" type="main" key="subla^cri^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lăcrĭmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>lacrimo</etym>, <sense id="n45934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weeping a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublamina: <entryFree id="n45935" type="hapax" key="subla_mi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lāmĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n45935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-plate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sublapsus: <entryFree id="n45936" type="main" key="sublapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of sublabor.</entryFree>
sublaqueum: <entryFree id="n45937" type="main" key="Subla^que^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sublăquĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little town of the Æqui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near which Nero had a country-seat</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Subiaco</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 22</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sublăcen-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sublaqueum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa,</quote> <trans><tr>that of Nero</tr>, <tr>near Sublaqueum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 93" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <trans><tr>constructed there by him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>; 14; 15.</sense></entryFree>
sublate: <entryFree id="n45938" type="main" key="subla_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tollo, <sense id="n45938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sublatio: <entryFree id="n45939" type="main" key="subla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> [tollo), <sense id="n45939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lifting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45939.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: a sublatione (soni) ad positionem, <hi rend="ital">an upward beat</hi> in marking time, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 48</bibl>; so (opp. positio) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:48:section=55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 48, § 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45939.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n45939.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an elevation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exaltation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45939.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a removal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtiva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45939.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An abrogation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annulling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublatus: <entryFree id="n45940" type="main" key="subla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tollo; as <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. tollo <sense id="n45940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sublavo: <entryFree id="n45941" type="main" key="subla^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lăvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash from beneath</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): os vulvae vino, <cb n="SUBL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sublectio: <entryFree id="n45942" type="main" key="sublecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sublego</etym>, <sense id="n45942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gleaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leasing</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 31 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sublecto: <entryFree id="n45943" type="hapax" key="sublecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>sub-lacio</etym>, <sense id="n45943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wheedle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cajole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublectus: <entryFree id="n45944" type="main" key="sublectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sublego.</entryFree>
sublego: <entryFree id="n45945" type="main" key="suble^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lĕgo</orth>, <itype>lēgi, lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n45945.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To gather from below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gather</hi> or <hi rend="ital">search for underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gather up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puer) sublegit quodcumque jaceret inutile quodque Posset cenantes offendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baca tempestatibus in terram decidit et necesse est eam sublegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficum viridem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:17:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45945.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to catch up secretly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by stealth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45945.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos,</quote> <trans><tr>to kidnap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45945.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam alicujus sermonem,</quote> <trans><tr>to overhear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 98</bibl></cit>; so, sermonem hinc, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 332, 30</bibl> (Com. Fragm. 5 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45945.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To choose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elect in the place of</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegae, qui una lecti: et qui in eorum locum suppositi, sublecti: additi, allecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 66</bibl></cit> Müll.; Plebisc. Viator. tab. 1, line 41; tab. 2, line 4; <cit><quote lang="la">10: in demortuorum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in numerum patriciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes Latinorum in ordinem suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublestus: <entryFree id="n45946" type="main" key="sublestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>acc. to Döderl. Synon. 2, p. 101 sq., perh. from sublevo; and hence, light</etym>, <sense id="n45946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trivial</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sublesta antiqui dicebant infirma et tenuia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: fides sublestior, id est, infirmior. Idem in Nervolaria vinum ait sublestissimum, quia infirmos faciat vel corpore vel animo, Fest. pp. 294 and 295 Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublestum est leve, frivolum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 177, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublestus infirmus, tristis, Gloss. Isid.: fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublevatio: <entryFree id="n45947" type="main" key="suble^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublĕvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sublevo, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n45947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lightening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviation</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: sublevatio et medicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublevo: <entryFree id="n45948" type="main" key="suble^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lĕvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lift up from beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (class.: esp. freq. in the trop. sense; syn.: extollo, erigo). </sense><sense id="n45948.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nos sibi quondam ad pedes stratos ne sublevabat quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ascensu sublevati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterni innixi sublevantesque invicem et trahentes alii alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 20, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jubis equorum sublevati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erigere se aut sublevare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā sublevat ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 831</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes regem fessum umeris sublevant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 17, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter manus sublevantium exstinctus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 34</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentum sinistrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia furcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45948.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">console</hi> any one in misfortune (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilior, subvenio, lenio, sedo): aratores (opp. evertere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:92:section=215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 92, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines defendere et sublevare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (opp. deridere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (opp. laedere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter eos accusat, quod tam necessario tempore ab iis non sublevetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidanos re frumentariā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:34" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias liberalitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sublevandos alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 4</bibl></cit>. —Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">hic est status, qui unā voce omnium gemitur neque verbo cujusquam sublevatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45948.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">qualify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessen</hi> an evil, <hi rend="ital">to assuage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non denique aliquo mediocri vitio tot tantaque ejus vitia sublevata esse videbuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res adversae sublevantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam industriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum inopiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitates hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una illa sublevanda offensio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2</bibl></cit>: odia, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandimentum sublevavit metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis noyitatem dicendi gloriā maxime sublevabis,</quote> <trans><tr>will compensate for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublica: <entryFree id="n45949" type="main" key="subli^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pile</hi> driven into the ground, <hi rend="ital">a palisade</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">palus, sudes, stipes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>.—Esp., of <hi rend="ital">the piles for a bridge</hi>, <cb n="SUBL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 37</bibl>.—In the form sublices, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 77</bibl>; cf. Gloss. Labb.</sense></entryFree>
sublicius: <entryFree id="n45950" type="main" key="subli^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sublica</etym>, <sense id="n45950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resting upon piles</hi>: Pons Sublicius, <hi rend="ital">the pile-bridge</hi>, a wooden bridge across the Tiber, built by Ancus Marcius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 23, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 83</bibl>, and 6, § 44 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=293" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 293</bibl> ib.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 693 sq.—As the place where beggars sat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublido: <entryFree id="n45951" type="main" key="subli_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-laedo</etym>, <sense id="n45951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur voce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 915</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45951.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To injure by degrees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 8</bibl> (12), 2 dub.</sense></entryFree>
subligaculum: <entryFree id="n45952" type="main" key="subli^ga_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublĭgācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>subligo</etym>, <sense id="n45952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a waistband</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breech - cloth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 21</bibl>.—Called subsequently <orth extent="full" lang="la">sublĭ-gar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:87:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 87, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 59</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sublĭgātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subligatio: <entryFree id="n45953" type="hapax" key="subli^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tying below</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subligo: <entryFree id="n45954" type="main" key="subli^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tie below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind on</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. subnecto): vites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateri atque umeris ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum sinistrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:445" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 445</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (virum) balteus asper Subligat,</quote> <trans><tr>girds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:579" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tiaram extremā cervice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:700" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 700</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">subligata ludit,</quote> <trans><tr>trussed up</tr>, <tr>tucked up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 67, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublimatio: <entryFree id="n45955" type="main" key="subli_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sublimo</etym>, <sense id="n45955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lifting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sublimator: <entryFree id="n45956" type="main" key="subli_ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elevator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalter</hi> (late Lat.): Deus est Abrahami sublimator, Salv. Gub. Dei, 1, 8.</sense></entryFree>
sublime: <entryFree id="n45957" type="main" key="subli_me"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīme</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sublimis <sense id="n45957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sublimen: <entryFree id="n45958" type="main" key="subli_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-līmen</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>acc. to Ritschl, Opusc. 2, p. 464, = sublimen superum, referring to the hanging up of slaves for punishment; but acc. to Ussing ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:v. 859" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. v. 859</bibl> from sublimis</etym>, <sense id="n45958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upwards</hi> (mostly anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">facite illic homo jam in medicinam ablatus sublimen siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sublimen raptum oportuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 6</bibl></cit> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimen ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 13</bibl></cit> ib.; 5, 8, 3 ib. (in all these passages Brix reads sublimis, sublimem); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illum jubes ancillas rapere sublimen domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit> (Fleck. sublimem; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Ussing ad loc.): sublimen intro hunc rape,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit> Fleck. (Umpfenb. sublimem): <cit><quote lang="la">sublimen medium arriperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit> ib.: aspice hoc sublimen candens, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 10</bibl>; 3, 16, 40 B. and K. (al. sublime); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; <cit><quote lang="la">and Rib. writes sublimen (for sublimis, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 242</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 404</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 259</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 67</bibl>; 11, 722.—(For a full discussion of these passages and the word, v. Ritschl, Opusc. 2, p. 462 sqq.; R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> in Fleck. Jahrb. 77, p. 184</bibl> sqq.; and contra, R. Klotz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:page=197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. p. 197</bibl> sqq.)</sense></entryFree>
sublimis: <entryFree id="n45959" type="main" key="subli_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīmus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: ex sublimo vertice, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 7, 19; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 169</bibl>; Att. and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 489:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> ib. 489, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 340</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. sub-limen, up to the lintel; cf. sublimen</etym> (sublimem est in altitudinem elatum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl> Müll.), <sense id="n45959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uplifted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; not in Cic. or Cæs.; syn.: editus, arduus, celsus, altus). </sense><sense id="n45959.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45959.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vertex nobis semper sublimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 242</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis cacumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:752" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus (Iridis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 59, 60, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 86</bibl></cit> et saep.: os, <hi rend="ital">directed upwards</hi> (opp. to pronus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 85</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:673" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 673</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 457</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagellum,</quote> <trans><tr>uplifted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 26, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto sublimior Atlas Omnibus in Libyā sit montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphans in illo sublimissimo curru,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45959.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">borne aloft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uplifted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapite sublimem foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimem aliquem rapere (arripere, auferre, ferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 13</bibl>; 5, 8, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 255</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 722</bibl> (in all these passages others read sublimen, q. v.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> M 4, 363 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi armis sublimibus ardent,</quote> <trans><tr>borne aloft</tr>, <tr>lofty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 602</bibl></cit>: sublimes in <pb n="1779" /> <cb n="SUBL" /> equis redeunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 285</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparet liquido sublimis in aëre Nisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 404</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa (Venus) Paphum sublimis abit,</quote> <trans><tr>on high through the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimis abit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:648 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 648 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n45959.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">On high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a high position</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuem texens sublimis aranea telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem sublimem stramine ponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedens solio sublimis avito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrio jaceat sublimis in ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45959.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīme</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">height;</hi> sometimes to be rendered <hi rend="ital">the air</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piro per lusum in sublime jactato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27</bibl></cit>; so, in sublime, Auct. B. Afr. 84, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 38, 54, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:57" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 6, 31, § 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per sublime volantes grues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sublimi posita facies Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex sublimi devoluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 105, § 129</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquique memor metuit sublimia casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per maria ac terras sublimaque caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 340</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45959.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45959.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqui reges ac sublimes viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 378</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:301" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimis, cupidusque et amata relinquere pernix,</quote> <trans><tr>aspiring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 165</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nil parvum sapias et adhuc sublimia cures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā claritate nihil in rebus humanis sublimius duco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 5, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:232" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 232</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancimus supponi duos sublimissimos judices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 62, 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45959.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of language, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sublime</hi> (freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">sublimia carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clara et sublimia verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio (opp. causae summissae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis sublimia humilibus misceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 60</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of orators, poets, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">natura sublimis et acer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimis et gravis et grandiloquus (Aeschylus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trachalus plerumque sublimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 119</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimior gravitas Sophoclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimius aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sublimius illud pro Archiā, Saxa atque solitudines voci respondent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 75</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45959.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">aloft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on high.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45959.10" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-līmĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rare</orth>): <cit><quote lang="la">stare,</quote> <trans><tr>upright</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 70, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitur locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45959.11" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-līme</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>): <cit><quote lang="la">Theodori nihil interest, humine an sublime putescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta, quae fuerant sublime fixa, sunt humi inventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 31, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 56, 141</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expulsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 320</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n45959.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimius altum Attollit caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45959.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">in a lofty manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loftily</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">alia sublimius, alia gravius esse dicenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublimitas: <entryFree id="n45960" type="main" key="subli_mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sublimis</etym>, <sense id="n45960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loftiness</hi> (post-Aug.; cf. altitudo). </sense><sense id="n45960.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucurbitarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 69</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45960.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45960.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimitas incomparabilis invicti animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 26, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in picturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45960.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of language, <hi rend="ital">loftiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sublimity</hi> (while elevatio means disparagement): <cit><quote lang="la">heroici carminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his (poëtis) in verbis sublimitas petitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimitas et magnificentia et nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrandi (with splendor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platonica illa sublimitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublimiter: <entryFree id="n45961" type="main" key="subli_mi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīmĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sublimis <sense id="n45961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sublimitus: <entryFree id="n45962" type="hapax" key="subli_mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīmĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sublimis</etym>, <sense id="n45962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">up high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci militum equum sublimitus insilire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Ver. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Ver. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
sublimo: <entryFree id="n45963" type="main" key="subli_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lift up on high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi> (ante- and postclass.). </sense><sense id="n45963.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: facem (sol), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 11</bibl> (Trag. v. 319 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">se nubium tenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 340, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mid.: sublimata in altum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 2, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45963.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimavit dixit (Cato), id est in altum extulit, Originum, l. II.: in maximum decus atque in excelsissimam claritudinem sublimavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas praetoriis ornamentis sublimatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sublimus: <entryFree id="n45964" type="main" key="subli_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sublimis <sense id="n45964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> <cb n="SUBN" /></sense></entryFree>
sublingio: <entryFree id="n45965" type="hapax" key="sublingi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublingĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sub-lingo</etym>, <sense id="n45965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lick-dish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under-scullion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublinguium: <entryFree id="n45966" type="main" key="sublingui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublinguĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the epiglottis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 11, 1, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sublino: <entryFree id="n45967" type="main" key="subli^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lĭno</orth>, <itype>lēvi, lĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to besmear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anoint beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay on as a groundcolor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prime with</hi> any thing (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n45967.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">chrysocollam atramento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 6, 26, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum vivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 32, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem lacertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 9, 23, § 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45967.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45967.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underlay</hi> (syn. substerno): <cit><quote lang="la">maceriam calce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium (genus sardonychis) argenteis bracteis sublinitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 31, § 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45967.4" n="B" level="2"> Sublinere os alicui, <hi rend="ital">to befool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bamboozle</hi> (the allusion being to the practice of smearing the face of a sleeping person; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 45, 21</bibl>) (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre os sublevit patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sublitus: <entryFree id="n45968" type="main" key="subli^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sublino.</entryFree>
sublividus: <entryFree id="n45969" type="main" key="subli_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-līvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat blue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bluish</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pustulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 1</bibl></cit> and 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sublucanus: <entryFree id="n45970" type="hapax" key="sublu_ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lūcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux</etym>, <sense id="n45970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">towards day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards morning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subluceo: <entryFree id="n45971" type="main" key="sublu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lūcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gleam faintly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glimmer</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aries sublucet corpore totus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=289" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepuscula sublucent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fragmenta (picis), subluceant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(liquor) nigrantis rosae colore sublucens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violae sublucet purpura nigrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 275</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">candida nec mixto sublucent ora rubore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 217</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublucidus: <entryFree id="n45972" type="hapax" key="sublu_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lūcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lightish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subluco: <entryFree id="n45973" type="main" key="sublu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lūco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lux</etym>, <sense id="n45973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to trim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin out</hi> the branches of a tree, to admit light: <cit><quote lang="la">sublucare arbores est ramos earum supputare, et veluti subtus lucem mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=348" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 348</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor ... nisi a domino sublucari non potest, isque conveniendus est ut eam sublucet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. colluco.</sense></entryFree>
sublugeo: <entryFree id="n45974" type="gloss" key="sublu_ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lūgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lament a little</hi>, Inscr. Cenot. Pis. ap. Orell. 643.</sense></entryFree>
subluo: <entryFree id="n45975" type="main" key="sublu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lŭo</orth>, no <sense id="n45975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>lūtum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to wash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bathe underneath</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n45975.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid aquā calidā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:32:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 32, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inguina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:81:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 81, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subluto podice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:42:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 42, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45975.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of rivers, <hi rend="ital">to flow along the base of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wash the foot of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc montem flumen subluebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
