C. 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices collis (flumina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 69</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asia, quā Hellesponto, quā rubro mari subluitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublustris: <entryFree id="n45976" type="main" key="sublustris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublustris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-lux</etym>, <sense id="n45976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">giving some light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a faint light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glimmering</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare). </sense><sense id="n45976.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra (noctis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 373</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:141" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 141</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n45976.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae Latinae lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subluteus: <entryFree id="n45977" type="main" key="sublu_te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-lūtĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellowish</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 348, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color purpurei luminis suffectione subluteus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sublutus: <entryFree id="n45978" type="main" key="sublu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subluo.</entryFree>
subluvies: <entryFree id="n45979" type="main" key="sublu^vi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sublŭvĭes</orth>, <itype>em, e</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subluo, that which is washed off</etym>, <sense id="n45979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n45979.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">via subluvie caenosā lubrica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45979.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a disease in the feet of sheep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the foul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in the feet of men,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 9, 23, § 80</bibl></cit>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sublŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
subm: <entryFree id="n45980" type="main" key="subm"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>, v. summ-.</entryFree>
subnascor: <entryFree id="n45981" type="main" key="subnascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-nascor</orth>, <itype>nātus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n45981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow up under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">after; to follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">num vada subnatis imo viridentur ab herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:90" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (cortex) subnascente alio expellitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 234</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 22, 34, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castaneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 5:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua, id. Ira, 2, 10, 5: ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:65" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 65</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SUBN" /></sense></entryFree>
subnato: <entryFree id="n45982" type="main" key="subna^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-năto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim beneath</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pars subnatat unda Membrorum, pars exstat aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:482" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus bijuges alii subnatant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subnatus: <entryFree id="n45983" type="main" key="subna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subnascor.</entryFree>
subnavigo: <entryFree id="n45984" type="main" key="subna_vi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-nāvĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sail under the lee</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 4</bibl></cit> (transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(pepleu/samen</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
subnecto: <entryFree id="n45985" type="main" key="subnecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-necto</orth>, <itype>nexui, xum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tie under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind on beneath</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn. subligo). </sense><sense id="n45985.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">antennis velum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingula mammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui de vimine circlos Cervici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subnectit fibula vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragmentum clavi collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 11, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specieque comam subnexus utrāque,</quote> <trans><tr>wreathed</tr>, <tr>garlanded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:113" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 113</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n45985.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi> in speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inventioni judicium subnecterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde proxima subnectens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subnectit et hanc fabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callide subnectit, confictas a se epistulas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subnego: <entryFree id="n45986" type="hapax" key="subne^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-nĕgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to half deny</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod praesenti tibi prope subnegāram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subnero: <entryFree id="n45987" type="main" key="Subne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Subnĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sub-Nero</etym>, <sense id="n45987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the second Nero</hi>, an appellation given to the emperor Domitian, on account of his crimes, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl> (cf. of the same: <cit><quote lang="la">calvus Nero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
subnervo: <entryFree id="n45988" type="main" key="subnervo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subnervo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-nervus, to cut the sinew beneath</etym>, <sense id="n45988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hamstring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hough</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n45988.1" n="I" level="1"> Taurum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45988.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to invalidate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumnias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 327</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subnexus: <entryFree id="n45989" type="main" key="subnexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subnexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subnecto.</entryFree>
subniger: <entryFree id="n45990" type="main" key="subni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-nĭger</orth>, <itype>gra, grum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat black</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blackish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventriosus, subniger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labris (canum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color (cutis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subnisus: <entryFree id="n45991" type="main" key="subni_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-nīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. subnixus.</entryFree>
subnixus: <entryFree id="n45992" type="main" key="subnixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-nixus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nīsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [nitor], <sense id="n45992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supported from beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under-propped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propped up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supported by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leaning upon</hi> any thing, etc. (class., esp. in the trop. sense; cf. suffultus). </sense><sense id="n45992.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(duos circulos) caeli verticibus ipsis ex utrāque parte subnixos vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solioque alte subnixa resedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 506</bibl></cit>: parva Philoctetae subnixa Petelia muro, <hi rend="ital">supported</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">defended by</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 402</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subnixae nubibus altis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cir. 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubito subnixa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 348</bibl></cit>: Caesariem tunc forte Venus subnixa corusco Fingebat solio, Claud. Epith. Hon. et Mar. 99; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Cent. Nupt. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subnixas jugis immanibus aedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galea coruscis subnixa cristis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:398" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subnixis alis me inferam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with my arms a-kimbo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45992.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45992.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Relying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depending upon</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n45992.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriis divitiisque subnixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Bastarnas cernerent subnixos Thracum auxiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal subnixus victoriā Cannensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">validis propinquitatibus subnixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas tot illustribus viris subnixa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrogantiā subnixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robore mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:40:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 40, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Mil. 8" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Mil. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45992.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: Latini subnixo animo ex victoriā inerti, consilium ineunt, Cael. (or Quadrig.) ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 405, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45992.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subnixus et fidens innocentiae animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 42, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45992.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subject to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subnotatio: <entryFree id="n45993" type="main" key="subno^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subnŏtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subnoto</etym>, <sense id="n45993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a signing underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subscription</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 23, 6</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 5, 22; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subnoto: <entryFree id="n45994" type="main" key="subno^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-nŏto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n45994.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">write underneath</hi> (cf. subscribo): <cit><quote lang="la">in inferiori lineā particulares propositiones subnotentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 31, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina palam,</quote> <trans><tr>to write down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos,</quote> <trans><tr>to subscribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45994.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To note secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et non sobria verba subnotasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:28:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vultu digitoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:82:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 82, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subnuba: <entryFree id="n45995" type="hapax" key="subnu^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subnŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-nubo</etym>, <sense id="n45995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rival</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti subnuba nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 153</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subnubilus: <entryFree id="n45996" type="main" key="subnu_bi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-nūbĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi> <pb n="1780" /> <cb n="SUBO" /> <hi rend="ital">cloudy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">overcast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather gloomy</hi>: nox, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 599</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subo: <entryFree id="n45997" type="main" key="su^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in heat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45997.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. of sows, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 181</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45997.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45997.3" n="A" level="2"> Of other animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1199</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 298, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45997.4" n="B" level="2"> Of women, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; Hier. ap. Jovin. 1, 38; 2, 36.</sense></entryFree>
subobscenus: <entryFree id="n45998" type="hapax" key="su^bobsce_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-obscēnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-caenus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat smutty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obscene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subobscure: <entryFree id="n45999" type="main" key="su^bobscu_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbobscūrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. subobscurus.</entryFree>
subobscurus: <entryFree id="n46000" type="main" key="su^bobscu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-obscūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat obscure;</hi> trop., of language: <cit><quote lang="la">breves et ob eam ipsam causam interdum subobscuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbob-scūrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat obscurely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subocrini: <entryFree id="n46001" type="main" key="Subocri_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sub-ocrīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subocularis: <entryFree id="n46002" type="hapax" key="su^bo^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ŏcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is beneath the eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subocular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subodiosus: <entryFree id="n46003" type="hapax" key="su^bo^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ŏdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat vexatious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">odious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suboffendo: <entryFree id="n46004" type="hapax" key="suboffendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-offendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give some offence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud faecem populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suboleo: <entryFree id="n46005" type="main" key="su^bo^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ŏlĕo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏlo</orth>, <sense id="n46005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> subolat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 26</bibl>; cf. oleo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (prop. to emit a smell; only trop. and in <hi rend="ital">third pers. sing.</hi>): hoc subolet alicui, or <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> subolet (alicui), <hi rend="ital">to smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, etc.), <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detect</hi>, etc. (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">id jam pridem sensi et subolet mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propemodum quod illic festinet, sentio et subolet mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">scio equidem te, animatus ut sis: video, subolet, sentio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suboles: <entryFree id="n46006" type="main" key="su^bo^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbŏles</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏbŏles</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub- 2. oleo, olesco</etym>, <sense id="n46006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offshoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suboles ab olescendo, id est crescendo, ut adulescentes quoque et adultae et indoles dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl></cit> Müll. </sense><sense id="n46006.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. surculus), of plants: ulmum serere ex subolibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caepa, quae non habuit suboles adhaerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 12, § 65</bibl> et saep. —Of the hair: ex subolibus parvuli (capilli) demittebantur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 456, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum capillus frequenti subole cumulat verticem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 218, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46006.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of men and beasts, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lineage</hi> (class.; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 153</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: proles, progenies): censores populi aevitates, suboles, familias pecuniasque censento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propagatio et suboles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1232</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(rex Superum) subolem priori Dissimilem populo promittit origine mirā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cara deum suboles, magnum Jovis incrementum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hem subolem sis vide!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suboles juventutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 54</bibl></cit>: robur et suboles militum interiit, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites, favete nomini Scipionum, suboli imperatorum vestrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunati patris matura suboles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua mihi de te suscepta fuisset Ante fugam suboles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva (Lucina), producas subolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae suboles,</quote> <trans><tr>the race of Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archytae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 77: <cit><quote lang="la">Sarmatae, Medorum suboles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec suboles nomen habuit Epigoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpem regiae subolis delere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 1, 15</bibl></cit>. —Of the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">per suboles subolum multiplicata semper innumerabilitas ampliatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> Hildebr.—Of beasts: <cit><quote lang="la">lascivi suboles gregis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subolesco: <entryFree id="n46007" type="main" key="su^bo^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ŏlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n46007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">juventus subolescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subolescere imperio adultos ejus filios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subolfacio: <entryFree id="n46008" type="hapax" key="su^bolfa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-olfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>cĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smell out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive by the scent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subolfacio, quod nobis epulum daturus est Mammea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suborior: <entryFree id="n46009" type="main" key="su^bo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype>, <sense id="n46009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1036" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1036</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1049" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1049</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1138" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metallorum opulentia tot saeculis suboriens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 207</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subornator: <entryFree id="n46010" type="main" key="su^borna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbornātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>suborno</etym>, <sense id="n46010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instigator</hi>,<cb n="SUBS" />  <hi rend="ital">abettor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suborner</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subornatores ac delatores puniuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subornatore et conscio praefecto praetorio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
suborno: <entryFree id="n46011" type="main" key="su^borno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-orno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n46011.0" n="I" level="1"> With the idea of the verb predominating, <hi rend="ital">to fit out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi> (class.; syn. instruo): aliquem pecuniā, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 16, 32</bibl>: vigilanter nervoseque nos, qui stamus in acie, subornes, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenulati isti in militum cultum subornati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:28:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturae insignia invasit, praecedentibus in modum lictorum subornatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se ipse norit, intelliget, quemadmodum a naturā subornatus in vitam venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo non eruditus nec ullis praeceptis contra mortem aut dolorem subornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leporem pinnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46011.1" n="II" level="1"> With the idea of the preposition predom., <hi rend="ital">to incite secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to instigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suborn</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seduco, suppono): fictus testis subornari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 35, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum testem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 17, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatores esse instructos et subornatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicum indicem subornabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem subornatis, qui sibi manus adlatas esse dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem, ut perferret nuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedonas tres ad caedem regis subornat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 44, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo subornati falsis criminibus occupant aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes interfectorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterosque, ejusdem amentiae, in corpus meum subornavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem in bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:7:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad occupandum regnum filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:14:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:11:6" default="NO">11, 11, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subortus: <entryFree id="n46012" type="hapax" key="su^bortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbortus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>suborior</etym>, <sense id="n46012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rising</hi> or <hi rend="ital">springing up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 303</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subostendo: <entryFree id="n46013" type="main" key="su^bostendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ostendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to point out secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show indirectly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 38 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Valent. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes adventus Domini subostensa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bapt. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subostensus: <entryFree id="n46014" type="main" key="subostensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subostensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subostendo.</entryFree>
subota: <entryFree id="n46015" type="main" key="Subota"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Subota</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subp: <entryFree id="n46016" type="main" key="subp"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>, v. supp-.</entryFree>
subquartus: <entryFree id="n46017" type="main" key="subquartus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-quartus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(pote/tartos</foreign>, <sense id="n46017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one fourth less</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 761</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subr: <entryFree id="n46018" type="main" key="subr"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>, v. surr-.</entryFree>
subsalsus: <entryFree id="n46019" type="main" key="subsalsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-salsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat salt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brackish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 29, 103, § 175</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsannatio: <entryFree id="n46020" type="main" key="subsanna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sannātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subsanno</etym>, <sense id="n46020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mockery by gestures</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derision in pantomime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:34:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 34, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsannator: <entryFree id="n46021" type="main" key="subsanna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsannātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who insults</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mocks by gestures</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 33, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsanno: <entryFree id="n46022" type="main" key="subsanno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sanno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sanna</etym>, <sense id="n46022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to insult by derisive gestures</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mock</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ecce ipsi quasi subsannantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:34:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 34, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:37:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 37, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsarcino: <entryFree id="n46023" type="main" key="subsarci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsarcĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to repair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heal</hi> (late Lat.), Victor Funon. Poenit. 29.</sense></entryFree>
subscalpo: <entryFree id="n46024" type="hapax" key="subscalpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-scalpo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scratch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rub underneath</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subscribendarius: <entryFree id="n46025" type="main" key="subscri_benda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-scrībendārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scribo</etym>, <sense id="n46025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-secretary</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 7, 4, 1; 7, 84, 8 al.</sense></entryFree>
subscribo: <entryFree id="n46026" type="main" key="subscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n46026.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To write underneath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">below</hi> (class.; cf. subnoto). </sense><sense id="n46026.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">statuis inauratis ... subscripsit, Reges ab se in gratiam esse reductos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subscripsere quidam L. Bruti statuae: utinam viveres, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quaeret Pater Urbium Subscribi statuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">meo subscribi causa sepulcro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 563</bibl></cit>: quarum (litterarum) exemplum subscripsi, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13</bibl>, A, § 1; Treb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seminaria ulmorum parentur eā ratione, quam deinceps subscripsimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46026.3" n="1" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to write down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">subscribe one's name</hi> to an accusation (either as principal prosecutor or as seconding others), together with the ground of the charge; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosecute</hi>: in L. Popillium subscripsit L. Gellius, quod <cb n="SUBS" /> is pecuniam accepisset, quo innocentem condemnaret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 47, 131</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia parricidii causa subscripta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:19:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 19, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinium de ambitu reum fecit P. Sulla, subscribente privigno Memmio, fratre Caecilio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Capito Agrippae subscripsit in C. Cassium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 5</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">accusanti patrono subscripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras subscribam homini dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:92" default="NO">47, 2, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.4" n="2" level="3"> Publicists' t. t., of the censor, <hi rend="ital">to write down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note down</hi> the reason of his official censure under or against the name of the person censured: <cit><quote lang="la">video animadvertisse censores in judices quosdam illius consilii Juniani, cum istam ipsam causam subscriberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 42, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censor C. Ateium notavit, quod ementitum auspicia subscripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 16, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quae de judicio corrupto subscripserint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 45, 127</bibl></cit>: ac primum illud statuamus, utrum quia censores subscripserint, ita sit; <cit><quote lang="la">an quia ita fuerit, illi subscripserint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod censores de ceteris subscripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subscribe</hi> a document (by appending one's name or a formula of greeting; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): omnes (tutores) debent unius editioni subscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationibus, testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:40" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, also, rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:80" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35, 1, 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:12" default="NO">34, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si subscripserit in tabulis emptionis, concessisse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:6:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, 6, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de supplicio cujusdam capite damnati, ut ex more subscriberet, admoneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Commodus in subscribendo tardus et neglegens, ita ut libellis una forma multis subscriberet, in epistolis autem plurimis Vale tantum scriberet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl> Wolf (cf. Dio, 57, 11).—</sense><sense id="n46026.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46026.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To assent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approve of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam prius pro potestate subscripsit, quam quingenties sestertium ad peragendam Auream domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut gratiae aut odio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiis accusationibusque Hannibalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationi alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fortuna voto subscripserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: tuo desiderio, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 95</bibl> (96): <cit><quote lang="la">amoribus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accord</hi> a thing to any one (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idol. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.9" n="II" level="1"> (With the idea of the verb predom.) <hi rend="ital">To write</hi> or <hi rend="ital">note down</hi> (=notare; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): numerum aratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:51:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 51, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiria nostra (a delatoribus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit> (acc. to others this passage belongs to B. 1.).</sense></entryFree>
subscriptio: <entryFree id="n46027" type="main" key="subscripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subscribo</etym>. <sense id="n46027.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing written underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a subscription</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n46027.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Serapionis subscriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46027.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46027.3" n="1" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a subscription</hi> to an accusation: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui crimen obiciatur, praecedere debet in crimen subscriptio, quae res ad id inventa est, ne facile quis prosiliat ad accusationem, cum sciat inultam sibi non futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:26:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consecratur subscriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 22:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Lud. Mort. Claud. 14:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lud. Mort. Claud. 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 14:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 15:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—Also of a <hi rend="ital">joint subscription</hi>, by one who seconds the accusation (cf. subscribo, I. B. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">subscriptionem sibi postularunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46027.4" n="2" level="3"> Publicists' t. t., of the censor, <hi rend="ital">a noting down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note</hi> of the offence censured: <cit><quote lang="la">subscriptio censoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42, 118</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46027.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A signature</hi> of a document (consisting of the subscription of one's name or the appending of a formula of greeting; <cit><quote lang="la">v. subscribo, I. B. 3.): si testator specialiter subscriptione suā declaraverit, dictasse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque imperator per epistolam et subscriptionem statuit, legem esse constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Rhodiorum magistratus, quod litteras publicas sine subscriptione ad se dederant, evocasset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl></cit> Wolf (cf. Dio, 57, 11).—</sense><sense id="n46027.6" n="4" level="3"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">a warrant</hi> of the emperor (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 9</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n46027.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A list</hi>, <hi rend="ital">register</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugerum subscriptio ac professio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 3, 47, § 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subscriptor: <entryFree id="n46028" type="main" key="subscriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subscriptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n46028.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to subscribo, I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">A signer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joint-signer</hi> <pb n="1781" /> <cb n="SUBS" /> of an accusation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venalis scriptor et subscriptor tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:19:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatore Lentulo subscriptoribusque ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: sine ullo subscriptore descendit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46028.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to subscribo, I. B. 3. b.) <hi rend="ital">One who subscribes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assents to</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">a favorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approver</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae legisque fundus subscriptorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscriptores approbatoresque verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subscriptus: <entryFree id="n46029" type="main" key="subscriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subscribo.</entryFree>
subscruposus: <entryFree id="n46030" type="main" key="subscru_po_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-scrūpōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (late Lat.), <sense id="n46030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sharp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">critical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">examinator meritorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subscus: <entryFree id="n46031" type="main" key="subscu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subscūs</orth>, <itype>ūdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-cudo</etym>, <sense id="n46031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tongue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tenon of a dovetail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscudes appellantur cuneatae tabellae, quibus tabulae inter se configuntur, quia, quo eae immittuntur, succuditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl></cit> Müll.: nec ulla subscus cohibet compagem alvei, Pac. ap. Fest. l. l. (Trag. Rel. v. 250 Rib.): terebratus multum sit et subscudes additae, Plaut. ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscudibus et catenis uncis retentari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—Collat. form of <number>plur.</number> subscudines, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 27.</sense></entryFree>
subsecivus: <entryFree id="n46032" type="main" key="subse^ci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕcīvus</orth>, v. subsicivus.</entryFree>
subseco: <entryFree id="n46033" type="main" key="subse^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĕco</orth>, <itype>cui, ctum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut away below; to clip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pare</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): stramentum et manipulum falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: herbam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:49:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 49, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:23:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes, unde creatus erat (Saturnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:276" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:230" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papavereas ungue comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:438" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 438</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsectus: <entryFree id="n46034" type="main" key="subsectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subseco.</entryFree>
subsecundarius: <entryFree id="n46035" type="hapax" key="subse^cunda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĕcundārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that comes afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">additional</hi>: tempora, <hi rend="ital">spare time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leisure moments</hi> (with subseciva), Gell. N. A. praef. § 23.</sense></entryFree>
subsellium: <entryFree id="n46036" type="main" key="subselli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsellĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sub-sella</etym>, <sense id="n46036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a low bench</hi> (quod non plane erat sella, subsellium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=128" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 128</bibl> Müll.); hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a bench</hi> for sitting upon, <hi rend="ital">a seat</hi> of any kind (in a house, the theatre, the curia, a court, etc.; syn.: scamnum, sedile). </sense><sense id="n46036.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ter. 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 1</bibl>.—Of places in the theatre: <cit><quote lang="la">ut conquisitores singuli in subsellia Eant per totam caveam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 5</bibl>; Cic. Corn. Fragm. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> (ap. Orell. V. 2, p. 68); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 41 al.</bibl>—Of the seats of senators in the curia: <cit><quote lang="la">volo, hoc oratori contingat, ... ut locus in subselliis occupetur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23 al.</bibl>—In the courts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 14, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere in accusatorum subselliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advocato adversis subselliis sedenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:132" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:2" default="NO">12, 3, 2</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir imi subselli,</quote> <trans><tr>a man of no account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46036.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46036.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a judge's seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the bench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusabat tribunus plebis idem in contionibus, idem ad subsellia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ab subselliis in rostra detulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46036.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46036.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The bench</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the occupants of a bench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibis quantum subsellia quinque solus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:27:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 27, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46036.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribunal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">age vero ne semper forum, subsellia, rostra, curiamque meditere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia grandiorem et pleniorem vocem desiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 84, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longi subsellii judicatio et mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui habitaret in subselliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 264</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versatus in utrisque subselliis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as judge and advocate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsentator: <entryFree id="n46037" type="hapax" key="subsenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sub-sentio, formed after the analogy of assentator</etym>, <sense id="n46037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flatterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fawner</hi>: subdoli, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:13, p. 62" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 13, p. 62</bibl> Nieb.</sense></entryFree>
subsentio: <entryFree id="n46038" type="hapax" key="subsenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sentĭo</orth>, <itype>si, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to notice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perceive secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smell out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi subsensi id quoque, Illos ibi esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsequenter: <entryFree id="n46039" type="main" key="subse^quenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕquenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. subsequor <sense id="n46039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subsequium: <entryFree id="n46040" type="main" key="subse^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕquĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sub-sequor</etym>, <sense id="n46040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sequel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what follows after</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsequor: <entryFree id="n46041" type="main" key="subse^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĕquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow close after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immediately; to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensue</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n46041.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46041.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <cb n="SUBS" /> <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequor te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">has (cohortes) subsidiariae ternae subsequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:528" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 528</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46041.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom verba facis, subsequere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar equitatu praemisso sequebatur omnibus copiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11</bibl>; 5, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequitur, pressoque legit vestigia gressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequiturque manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:336" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 336</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46041.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. or abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hesperus) tum antecedens, tum subsequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minorem Septentrionem Cepheus a tergo subsequitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis subsequens verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hos motus subsequi debet gestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totidem subsecuti libri Tusculanarum disputationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 496</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ducis consilia favor subsecutus militum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequenti tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">subsequenti anno,</quote> <trans><tr>the following</tr>, <tr>next year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima subsequitur, quid agas, audire voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46041.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to follow after</hi>, mentally or in opinion, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comply with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conform to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitate</hi> a person or thing; with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Speusippus Platonem avunculum subsequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut locupletes omnes summum ordinem subsequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te imitari. te subsequi student,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:84:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 84, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirifice ipse suo sermone subsecutus est humanitatem litterarum tuarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orationis) vim ac varietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 7, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕquenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one after another</hi>, Mess. Corv. Prog. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enarr. in Psa. 87" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
